title: PIER / JOYCE INTRO
description:
Joyce is on her boat. She welcomes you and tells you about the situation, her role in it, what happened w hanged man.
1. Finishes task: find wild pines rep
2. Finishes task: reality lowdown
2. Gives task: investigate traffic jam
3. Volition white to get 130 real

dialogueTree.title: Joyce Messier: ""Yes -- but please don't call me th..."
dialogueTree.text: "Yes -- but please don't call me that."

links.title: You: ""Why?""
links.text: "Why?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""*Joyce* is much more efficient.""
links.text: "*Joyce* is much more efficient."

links.title: Empathy: "She doesn't like it. Probably a bad..."
links.text: She doesn't like it. Probably a bad memory. Mean girls at school or some ancient lover...

links.title: You: ""Your name is Rejoyce?""
links.text: "Your name is Rejoyce?"

links.title: You: ""You're from Vesper?""
links.text: "You're from Vesper?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""My husband is. I have dual citizen..."
links.text: "My husband is. I have dual citizenship. A Vespertine is handier when travelling."

links.title: You: ""Everything appears to be in order...."
links.text: "Everything appears to be in order." (Give the documents back.)

links.title: Joyce Messier: "She nods and returns the plastic ba..."
links.text: She nods and returns the plastic bag to her coat.

dialogueTree.title: Rhetoric: "You *need* to make this lady admit..."
dialogueTree.text: You *need* to make this lady admit she's only riding around on this boat because she's rich.

links.title: You: "Yes, I do!"
links.text: Yes, I do!

links.title: Rhetoric: "You have the guns and the ammo! Tak..."
links.text: You have the guns and the ammo! Take this *klassenfeind* down!

links.title: You: "Uhm... why?"
links.text: Uhm... why?

links.title: Rhetoric: "Why what? Stop thinking. Take her d..."
links.text: Why what? Stop thinking. Take her down.

links.title: You: "It'll come off like I'm envious. An..."
links.text: It'll come off like I'm envious. And I'm not.

links.title: Rhetoric: "You're *not*? Okay then, just keep..."
links.text: You're *not*? Okay then, just keep on admiring the boat then, unburdened by envy.

links.title: You: "Why am I even thinking about this?..."
links.text: Why am I even thinking about this? I have police work to do.

links.title: Rhetoric: "Have it your way."
links.text: Have it your way.

links.title: You: "Actually, yes. I need to nail her f..."
links.text: Actually, yes. I need to nail her for this.

links.title: Rhetoric: "Charge! You've got the guns and the..."
links.text: Charge! You've got the guns and the ammo.

links.title: Authority: "She's having a good time arguing ag..."
links.text: She's having a good time arguing against the law. Too good, perhaps?

dialogueTree.title: Joyce Messier: ""The *performative experience* has..."
dialogueTree.text: "The *performative experience* has ended. Good -- what can I help you with?"

links.title: You: ""I spoke with the lorrymen at the r..."
links.text: "I spoke with the lorrymen at the roundabout."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Yes, my eyes on the harbour have s..."
links.text: "Yes, my eyes on the harbour have sent word to that effect -- what have you discovered?"

links.title: You: ""Wait, where exactly are these *eye..."
links.text: "Wait, where exactly are these *eyes* located?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""It doesn't really matter -- and I..."
links.text: "It doesn't really matter -- and I do apologize for the surveillance. Wild Pines can't afford to be blind at a time like this."

links.title: Visual Calculus: "One of the tall buildings overlooki..."
links.text: One of the tall buildings overlooking the roundabout, most likely. That would give them a read on the entire quarter.

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""In any case, it's a relief to know..."
links.text: "In any case, it's a relief to know someone has looked into it. If I may ask -- will there be an official investigation? I assume you discovered there *is* an operation..."

links.title: You: ""We have discovered enough to concl..."
links.text: "We have discovered enough to conclude -- for now."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Yes -- and? Will you start an offi..."
links.text: "Yes -- and? Will you start an official investigation?"

links.title: Empathy: "She's trying to conceal her excitem..."
links.text: She's trying to conceal her excitement, but the slight glimmer in her green eyes tells you otherwise.

links.title: Authority: "The lieutenant is about to interjec..."
links.text: The lieutenant is about to interject. Cut him off. This decision should be yours.

links.title: You: "Yes -- I should decide."
links.text: Yes -- I should decide.

links.title: Authority: "Exactly -- but what?"
links.text: Exactly -- but what?

links.title: You: "Let the lieutenant handle it."
links.text: Let the lieutenant handle it.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""*If* there is an investigation it..."
links.text: "*If* there is an investigation it will be part of an ongoing operation -- subject to confidentiality. I am sure you understand."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Of course, detectives," she says,..."
links.text: "Of course, detectives," she says, her tone more cautious suddenly. "In any case, you've held up your end of our arrangement. I trust you with the rest. Now it's my turn..."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""I wouldn't normally break protocol..."
links.text: "I wouldn't normally break protocol like this, but the situation demands it. If you don't solve this murder I'm afraid we may have a blood bath on our hands."

links.title: Half Light: "The words *blood bath* sound cold i..."
links.text: The words *blood bath* sound cold in her mouth. They taste of iron and strawberries.

links.title: You: ""Hold on, you seem anxious to know...."
links.text: "Hold on, you seem anxious to know. Why's that?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""I've kept my eye on the camionneur..."
links.text: "I've kept my eye on the camionneurs -- even tried to get to know one. It's a *mystery* I'm already invested in: which one of them, if any, could organize such a complex operation?"

links.title: You: ""There will be an investigation, th..."
links.text: "There will be an investigation, that's all I can say."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Okay. I thank you for sharing that..."
links.text: "Okay. I thank you for sharing that much with me." She exhales, as though a weight has been lifted from her shoulders. "My employer thanks you as well..."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""In any case, you've held up your e..."
links.text: "In any case, you've held up your end of our arrangement. Now it's my turn..."

links.title: You: ""You sent us on a wild goose chase...."
links.text: "You sent us on a wild goose chase. There's nothing to investigate."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""I don't believe that for one momen..."
links.text: "I don't believe that for one moment, officer." There is a pause, then her stern expression clears. "I'm just going to assume that departmental regulations prevent you from saying anything more..."

links.title: You: ""We turned up quite a few *interest..."
links.text: "We turned up quite a few *interesting* things actually..." (Share information.)

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Ah, good to hear. I wouldn't want..."
links.text: "Ah, good to hear. I wouldn't want to pry into a confidential police matter. But, in the event you'd like to share more... I *would* like to know who it was."

links.title: Volition: "Yes. *All* ears. That's how she ope..."
links.text: Yes. *All* ears. That's how she operates.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant clears his throat au..."
links.text: The lieutenant clears his throat audibly.

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "Be very careful, what information y..."
links.text: Be very careful, what information you're gonna share with her.

links.title: You: ""It's a she, by the way.""
links.text: "It's a she, by the way."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Clever. Few suspect a woman in thi..."
links.text: "Clever. Few suspect a woman in this sort of skulduggery. Good move on their part."

links.title: You: ""It seems the architect of the oper..."
links.text: "It seems the architect of the operation has gone missing. An abandoned lorry is near the statue."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""A runaway? Good work, this is a ta..."
links.text: "A runaway? Good work, this is a tangible lead towards solving the whole mystery."

links.title: You: ""She's a fan of vintage movie stars..."
links.text: "She's a fan of vintage movie stars. The inside of the cab was plastered with posters."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""We contain multitudes, do we not?..."
links.text: "We contain multitudes, do we not? It might not be pertinent to her... *profession*, but who knows? It may help you find her yet."

links.title: Suggestion: "She means: you know her closer now,..."
links.text: She means: you know her closer now, in some way you know her soul a bit.

links.title: You: ""I saw a really advanced radio syst..."
links.text: "I saw a really advanced radio system with *a lot* of stations saved."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""That speaks of the vastness and so..."
links.text: "That speaks of the vastness and sophistication of the operation. Were you able to examine the radio?"

links.title: You: ""It didn't have Speedfreaks FM.""
links.text: "It didn't have Speedfreaks FM."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""What is... speedfreaks FM?" She lo..."
links.text: "What is... speedfreaks FM?" She looks at you quizzically.

links.title: You: ""It's Lieutenant Kitsuragi's favour..."
links.text: "It's Lieutenant Kitsuragi's favourite radio station!"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant's stone-like face re..."
links.text: The lieutenant's stone-like face remains impassive, yet in his eyes -- a flash of reproach.

links.title: You: ""A very loud radio station about mo..."
links.text: "A very loud radio station about motor carriages and rock music, I think."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""I... fail to see the relevance of..."
links.text: "I... fail to see the relevance of this station, but..." she smiles warmly, "I'll defer to your judgement. Was there anything else?"

links.title: You: ""Unfortunately the dial knob was mi..."
links.text: "Unfortunately the dial knob was missing, the radio itself was inoperative."

links.title: Joyce Messier: "She nods. "Sensible for her to disa..."
links.text: She nods. "Sensible for her to disable access to such essential information."

links.title: You: ""It was the nerve-center for the op..."
links.text: "It was the nerve-center for the operation. She could contact a whole fleet of lorries."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Taking it out of commission will d..."
links.text: "Taking it out of commission will deal a blow to the smuggling network. Excellent work."

links.title: You: ""I found research about something c..."
links.text: "I found research about something called *ULAN* frequencies related to the operation."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""High intensity microwave frequenci..."
links.text: "High intensity microwave frequencies? They're used for navigational purposes, to compress the interisolary space. They may use it to communicate with incoming freighters..."

links.title: Logic: "As the shipments approach Revachol?..."
links.text: As the shipments approach Revachol? Hmm... somehow you suspect something more *sinister*.

links.title: Logic: "Let's be honest, you have no idea w..."
links.text: Let's be honest, you have no idea what that meant -- interisolary microwave compression? Moving on...

links.title: You: ""I came upon a few hidden maps illu..."
links.text: "I came upon a few hidden maps illustrating the range of the smuggling network."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""A first-rate find -- that should t..."
links.text: "A first-rate find -- that should tell you all you need to know about their network, I would imagine."

links.title: You: ""It's an octopus whose tentacles re..."
links.text: "It's an octopus whose tentacles reach every corner of the city."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""An ominous vision..." She nods sol..."
links.text: "An ominous vision..." She nods solemnly. "At least you understand the gravity of the situation. And the maps should prove very valuable indeed."

links.title: You: ""Yes. They're spread all over Jamro..."
links.text: "Yes. They're spread all over Jamrock... and beyond. I couldn't even identify the exact end points."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""So this goes *beyond* Jamrock... s..."
links.text: "So this goes *beyond* Jamrock... she looks inland. "At least you now understand the gravity of the situation. And those maps should prove very valuable indeed."

links.title: You: ""It's possible there's even a conne..."
links.text: "It's possible there's even a connection to La Puta Madre."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""What is La Puta Madre?""
links.text: "What is La Puta Madre?"

links.title: You: ""A seriously bad guy. I might even..."
links.text: "A seriously bad guy. I might even be on his take!"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""No, he's not. Our friend here has..."
links.text: "No, he's not. Our friend here has quite the sense of humour, part of his technique, you see?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Nevertheless, he sounds *terribly*..."
links.text: "Nevertheless, he sounds *terribly* dangerous. I urge you to take care, officer. I wouldn't want anything to happen to you."

links.title: You: ""A seriously bad guy.""
links.text: "A seriously bad guy."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Well, he sounds *very* dangerous...."
links.text: "Well, he sounds *very* dangerous. I urge you to take care, officer. I wouldn't want anything to happen to you. Not with what's coming..."

links.title: You: ""Better not to frighten you, ma'am.""
links.text: "Better not to frighten you, ma'am."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Frighten me?" She smiles. "I'm not..."
links.text: "Frighten me?" She smiles. "I'm not frightened easily, but I understand -- some things are best for the police to keep to themselves."

links.title: You: ""I've told you what I've found, now..."
links.text: "I've told you what I've found, now it's your turn." (Conclude.)

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""I appreciate you placing your trus..."
links.text: "I appreciate you placing your trust in me. Thank you again for looking into this matter. You have my gratitude -- and the gratitude of Wild Pines Group..."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Now, per our original agreement, i..."
links.text: "Now, per our original agreement, it's time for me to share company secrets with you." There's a change in her demeanour. A caution comes over her. A tension.

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Word has travelled, yes, but nothi..."
links.text: "Word has travelled, yes, but nothing of real substance has surfaced yet, I gather?" She smiles, then explains: "Wild Pines has eyes on the intersection -- but not ears."

links.title: Visual Calculus: "One of the tall buildings overlooki..."
links.text: One of the tall buildings overlooking the roundabout -- it would give them a read on the entire quarter.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""It appears we're being monitored e..."
links.text: "It appears we're being monitored every step we take, colleague." The lieutenant shrugs. "Did we have any other business here?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""On the contrary, officer," she smi..."
links.text: "On the contrary, officer," she smiles. "There are yet camionneurs you have not talked to. And don't look so surprised. In a time like this it would be strange if Wild Pines *didn't* have eyes on the harbour."

links.title: Visual Calculus: "They must have someone in an overlo..."
links.text: They must have someone in an overlook position, near the gates...

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""I suggest you go back and canvas f..."
links.text: "I suggest you go back and canvas for more suspects."

links.title: You: ""Okay. Tell me about this alleged d..."
links.text: "Okay. Tell me about this alleged drug trafficking."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Until you come up with something a..."
links.text: "Until you come up with something at that intersection I'm afraid I have little else to tell you -- but I'll try. Ask."

links.title: You: ""I heard something about a *complex..."
links.text: "I heard something about a *complex operation* earlier. This adds up."

links.title: Joyce Messier: "She nods. "I'm glad to hear, office..."
links.text: She nods. "I'm glad to hear, officer. I'm sure you'll find out just what that means, soon enough."

links.title: You: ""Why didn't you come to the RCM ear..."
links.text: "Why didn't you come to the RCM earlier?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""We *did*, on more than one occasio..."
links.text: "We *did*, on more than one occasion. Apparently there's some sort of inter-precinct disagreement about whose jurisdiction this area falls under."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""We know the company has launched i..."
links.text: "We know the company has launched its own probe into the Union's alleged involvement -- we also know it's come up empty. It's not just the RCM -- *no one's* been able to find any hard evidence."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Well," she smiles and points towar..."
links.text: "Well," she smiles and points toward the roundabout, "here's your chance, officers."

links.title: You: ""That's not really my area. I just..."
links.text: "That's not really my area. I just want to get to the bottom of this."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Well," she smiles and points towar..."
links.text: "Well," she smiles and points toward the roundabout, "here's your chance."

links.title: You: ""It's no coincidence the lorries ar..."
links.text: "It's no coincidence the lorries are stranded there like that, is it?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""No. We asked East Motor Tract to r..."
links.text: "No. We asked East Motor Tract to raise the drawbridge. The road company is a partner of one of our subsidiaries. However..." She pauses, looking to the sea.

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""This is a limited-time opportunity..."
links.text: "This is a limited-time opportunity. Once the complaint has been processed by the trade committee they'll have no choice but to lower the drawbridge -- and the operation will continue." She looks north.

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Thousands of litres of raw ingredi..."
links.text: "Thousands of litres of raw ingredients will pour onto the streets of Revachol. Not the East, across the river, but the West. The vulnerable, the weary..."

links.title: Shivers: "A cold breath rushes in from the ba..."
links.text: A cold breath rushes in from the bay, making its way down the alleyways and potholed streets -- from Martinaise to Jamrock. In the traffic you hear the clinking of glass vials, concealed beneath tarpaulin. Or is it just your teeth chattering in the cold?

links.title: You: "(Shiver.) "Fucking misery.""
links.text: (Shiver.) "Fucking misery."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""A lot of it," she nods. "It comes..."
links.text: "A lot of it," she nods. "It comes in from large Samaran factories. In South Safre, Siigay and Hsin-Yao. The literage they must get from this terminal alone must be *oceanic*."

links.title: You: "Shake it off."
links.text: Shake it off.

links.title: Joyce Messier: "She continues: "The literage the lo..."
links.text: She continues: "The literage the local producers must get from this terminal alone must be *oceanic*."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Well -- at least this solves *one*..."
links.text: "Well -- at least this solves *one* mystery."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""What is that lieutenant?""
links.text: "What is that lieutenant?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Why I had to call East Motor Tract..."
links.text: "Why I had to call East Motor Tract -- and *beg* them to open the drawbridge for me. I'd wondered since I first drove *in*. On my motor carriage."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""I am sorry for the inconvenience,..."
links.text: "I am sorry for the inconvenience, Lieutenant Kitsuragi. But we need them trapped here. This is a unique opportunity. I'm sure you understand."

links.title: You: ""What proof do you have that the Un..."
links.text: "What proof do you have that the Union is involved?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""How do you think they're financing..."
links.text: "How do you think they're financing this strike? There are thousands of unpaid dockworkers going strong for the fourth month straight."

links.title: You: ""I've heard they shook down local b..."
links.text: "I've heard they shook down local business owners. Drove a few out of business to finance it."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""With all due respect to these dese..."
links.text: "With all due respect to these desert cacti, the contents of a few cash registers cannot provide for *two-thousand* men. The local businesses can scarcely provide for themselves."

links.title: You: ""So you think the strike is being f..."
links.text: "So you think the strike is being funded with source ingredients for drugs?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Precisely. Smuggled out of that ve..."
links.text: "Precisely. Smuggled out of that very gate at night, most likely. Then loaded onto lorries and driven to Jamrock. You simply need to find *one* driver who'll open up to you."

links.title: Suggestion: "It sounds like she tried looking in..."
links.text: It sounds like she tried looking into it herself, though she's clearly not the type your typical lorryman would confide in.

links.title: Suggestion: "It sounds like she tried looking in..."
links.text: It sounds like she tried looking into it herself. But she's clearly not the type your typical lorryman would confide in.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""There was a shakedown of local bus..."
links.text: "There was a shakedown of local businesses preceding the strike. Many were squeezed to bankruptcy to fund it."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""It's true they drove a number of t..."
links.text: "It's true they drove a number of the local businesses to bankruptcy preparing for this venture. I've talked to a few business owners -- it was quite the shakedown. But the contents of a few cash registers cannot provide for *two thousand* men."

links.title: You: ""We already have some suspicions th..."
links.text: "We already have some suspicions that one of the drivers was present at the lynching."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""The two *might* even be connected.""
links.text: "The two *might* even be connected."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Or not -- though if you have evide..."
links.text: "Or not -- though if you have evidence to the contrary I'm *eager* to hear it."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""As eager as I am to *share* it, li..."
links.text: "As eager as I am to *share* it, lieutenant, once the job is done."

links.title: You: ""Okay. I've made up my mind about t..."
links.text: "Okay. I've made up my mind about the smuggling investigation..." (Proceed.)

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Yes?""
links.text: "Yes?"

links.title: You: ""I'll look into it, probe the drive..."
links.text: "I'll look into it, probe the drivers, see what it yields." (Accept.)

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Excellent." She takes a long sip o..."
links.text: "Excellent." She takes a long sip of tea. "According to my reports there are at least three lorry drivers lingering near the roundabout. Hopefully one of them will know something."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""It may come to nothing, or it may..."
links.text: "It may come to nothing, or it may just blow the case wide open. I can keep the drawbridge up for a few more days at least. You should have the time you need."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""In the meantime, let me know if th..."
links.text: "In the meantime, let me know if there's any other way I may be of assistance." She takes another long sip from her seemingly bottomless thermal cup.

links.title: Perception (Smell): "A waft of flowers and caramel reach..."
links.text: A waft of flowers and caramel reaches you where you're standing.

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""It may come to nothing, or it may..."
links.text: "It may come to nothing, or it may just blow the case wide open. I suspect the traffic jam won't disperse for a few more days. You should have the time you need."

links.title: You: ""There's no way I can take this cas..."
links.text: "There's no way I can take this case." (Refuse.)

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""I am very sad to hear that, office..."
links.text: "I am very sad to hear that, officer." Her voice is ice cold and laced with worry. "If you change your mind, please let me know. If not, good luck finding your badge -- and your memory."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""In the meantime, I'll still try to..."
links.text: "In the meantime, I'll still try to assist you any way I can. This disagreement is peanuts compared to what happens if you fail your main investigation."

links.title: You: ""Actually, let's discuss something..."
links.text: "Actually, let's discuss something else for now."

links.title: Joyce Messier: "She simply nods."
links.text: She simply nods.

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""The lorries are still stuck at the..."
links.text: "The lorries are still stuck at the roundabout -- if the police is asking, one of the drivers might admit to it."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""It's quite straightforward. Someon..."
links.text: "It's quite straightforward. Someone is using Terminal B to smuggle raw ingredients from the Samaran isola into Revachol with the Union's blessing. Wild Pines has suspected it for years."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Ingredients for *what*, ma'am?""
links.text: "Ingredients for *what*, ma'am?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Meth- and dextro-amphetamine, GBL..."
links.text: "Meth- and dextro-amphetamine, GBL and various synthetic psychedelics. Honestly, it might be quicker to say what you *can't* make from the stuff."

links.title: Electrochemistry: "Shit yeah, baby, it's the Party Pip..."
links.text: Shit yeah, baby, it's the Party Pipeline! Why would you want to shut that down?

links.title: You: ""Why are you trying to shut down th..."
links.text: "Why are you trying to shut down the Party Pipeline?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""I assure you, officer, these are *..."
links.text: "I assure you, officer, these are *not* the sort of parties you'd want to attend."

links.title: Electrochemistry: "She has no *idea* what kind of part..."
links.text: She has no *idea* what kind of parties you've been to.

links.title: You: ""Let me get this straight -- the ma..."
links.text: "Let me get this straight -- the materials come from Samara to Revachol *through* the terminal?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Yes. After they clear the terminal..."
links.text: "Yes. After they clear the terminal we lose track. The actual production is taking place at various sites in and around Jamrock Quarter. North of here."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Wild Pines seems to be *well appri..."
links.text: "Wild Pines seems to be *well apprised* of the local drug trade, ma'am. Do you mean to say the Union also *produces* the product? Sells drugs, I mean?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""We're in logistics. It's our busin..."
links.text: "We're in logistics. It's our business to know -- and no. As far as the company knows, the Union does not produce it. They transport the ingredients. For a cut."

links.title: You: ""And you want us to investigate." (..."
links.text: "And you want us to investigate." (Move on.)

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Yes. But you won't get anything ou..."
links.text: "Yes. But you won't get anything out of Evrart and the Dockworkers' Union. Still --" she raises her bony finger, "every chain has its weak link."

links.title: Logic: "The hand-off. The motor lorries at..."
links.text: The hand-off. The motor lorries at the roundabout.

links.title: You: ""The lorries.""
links.text: "The lorries."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""*Precisely*. Someone needs to move..."
links.text: "*Precisely*. Someone needs to move the ingredients *from* the harbour into the city. Once they reach Jamrock they're distributed to a network of local manufacturers, well beyond our grasp. But in transit they are *vulnerable*."

links.title: Logic: "Didn't Titus mention that Ruby ran..."
links.text: Didn't Titus mention that Ruby ran a *complex operation* out of her lorry? Could it be connected? Only one way to find out -- investigate!

links.title: Visual Calculus: "How convenient that they're strande..."
links.text: How convenient that they're stranded like beached whales at that roundabout.

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Perhaps you've noticed that a numb..."
links.text: "Perhaps you've noticed that a number of lorries are tangled in a traffic jam at the roundabout just now? Interview the drivers who are still hanging about. One of them might be waiting for a *crucial* shipment." She gives you a knowing look.

links.title: Perception (Sight): "Her irises are light green, like th..."
links.text: Her irises are light green, like the River Esperance in bright daylight, upstream where it's clearer.

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""I'll be explicit: if you find this..."
links.text: "I'll be explicit: if you find this driver, I will share company secrets with you."

links.title: Logic: "Uncovering Union secrets could also..."
links.text: Uncovering Union secrets could also give you an upper hand when dealing with them.

links.title: Authority: "You'll be indebted to her, in a way..."
links.text: You'll be indebted to her, in a way. But one step ahead of the Union in another...

links.title: You: ""Am I going to need bolt cutters fo..."
links.text: "Am I going to need bolt cutters for this?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Unlikely, officer. I'm talking abo..."
links.text: "Unlikely, officer. I'm talking about the lorries. Once the ingredients reach Jamrock they're distributed to a network of local manufacturers, well beyond our grasp. But in transit they may be *vulnerable*."

links.title: You: ""What do you mean?""
links.text: "What do you mean?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""The *lorries,*" she stresses. "Som..."
links.text: "The *lorries,*" she stresses. "Someone needs to move the ingredients from the harbour into the city. Once they reach Jamrock they're distributed to a network of local manufacturers, well beyond our grasp. But in transit they are *vulnerable*."

links.title: You: ""What kind of *ingredients* are we..."
links.text: "What kind of *ingredients* are we talking about here?"

links.title: You: ""I have a photo of the victim's tat..."
links.text: "I have a photo of the victim's tattoos." (Show it to her.)

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""I fear I've told you all I know."..."
links.text: "I fear I've told you all I know." She takes the photo. "It's an Oranjese Map of the Waterways -- or some version of it. It depicts the travels this man made while he was still alive."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Yes, extremely. Keep in mind, this..."
links.text: "Yes, extremely. Keep in mind, this is a negotiator Mr. Claire has worked with before, and who was more than fair with him and the Union."

links.title: Authority: "Sounds like usual aggressive postur..."
links.text: Sounds like usual aggressive posturing.

links.title: You: ""By the way, I've talked to Evrart..."
links.text: "By the way, I've talked to Evrart Claire."

links.title: You: "Look at her passport."
links.text: Look at her passport.

links.title: Joyce Messier: "The woman is silent, smiling while..."
links.text: The woman is silent, smiling while the waves lap against the hull. In your hand, under the plastic -- a light blue passport saying *REPUBLIC OF VESPER*. The coat of arms has a lion and an ostrich, sejant.

links.title: Encyclopedia: "The Republic of Vesper, formerly th..."
links.text: The Republic of Vesper, formerly the Republic of Vesper-Messina, was once a dual kingdom. An amicable parting of ways produced two constitutional monarchies. Vesper, the richer of the two, is an Occidental nation known for its proximity to the pale and its exotic financial derivatives.

links.title: You: "Anything else?"
links.text: Anything else?

links.title: Encyclopedia: "It is a stable country, and yet the..."
links.text: It is a stable country, and yet there has always been something *ominous* about its perfect stability, its place at the edge of the Mundi isola, overlooking the Ubi Sunt? isles fracturing into the Great Unrest of the pale.

links.title: You: "Look at the photo page."
links.text: Look at the photo page.

links.title: Joyce Messier: "The woman -- born in the year 3 in..."
links.text: The woman -- born in the year 3 in the Commune of Revachol -- smiles at you, face adorned with frown lines and crow's feet. The photo is recent. The name reads Rejoyce Leyton-Messier.

links.title: You: ""You're on a boat.""
links.text: "You're on a boat."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Well, technically speaking I'm not..."
links.text: "Well, technically speaking I'm not *on* it right now..." She looks at the sloop sway in the waves.

links.title: You: ""Let's talk about the *economics* o..."
links.text: "Let's talk about the *economics* of this boat you're on." (Go in for the kill.)

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Oh my, the *E-word*." She crosses..."
links.text: "Oh my, the *E-word*." She crosses her arms. "You mean to say that it's a symbol of *conspicuous consumption*? That I'm a member of the ruling class."

links.title: You: ""Yes. Exactly.""
links.text: "Yes. Exactly."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Detective, may I remind you that M..."
links.text: "Detective, may I remind you that Mrs. Messier is a *professional negotiator*?" He doesn't look like he thinks you'll best her in single combat.

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Then what is this positively desti..."
links.text: "Then what is this positively destitute *jetty* doing here?" She puts her foot down on the rotten planks beneath. "And what about that fleet of skiffs?"

links.title: Rhetoric: "A fleet? Three shabby fishing boats..."
links.text: A fleet? Three shabby fishing boats is hardly a *fleet*.

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""This unmistakably *proletarian* fl..."
links.text: "This unmistakably *proletarian* fleet of skiffs." She waves at the nearby fishing boats. "As I said, *plenty* of people drive boats. Of all social strata."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Then what does that say?" She poin..."
links.text: "Then what does that say?" She points to the plaque on the side of the pier. "Does it say *docking reserved for residents of Rue de Saint-Ghislaine 33A*?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""33A -- this old *proletarian* haun..."
links.text: "33A -- this old *proletarian* haunt here." She waves at the ruin looming overhead. "As I said, *plenty* of people drive boats. Of all social strata."

links.title: You: "Fire back -- quick!"
links.text: Fire back -- quick!

links.title: Reaction Speed: "Your synapses flash!"
links.text: Your synapses flash!

links.title: You: ""This house was built *before* the..."
links.text: "This house was built *before* the Revolution."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Okay. It *is* Antecentennial." She..."
links.text: "Okay. It *is* Antecentennial." She looks at the building looming overhead.

links.title: You: ""The people who live there now lead..."
links.text: "The people who live there now lead a different *lifestyle* if you know what I mean."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""I assure you, they drove quite a h..."
links.text: "I assure you, they drove quite a hard bargain for this space -- but you're right."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""I am a bourgeois woman and this is..."
links.text: "I am a bourgeois woman and this is my fast, lightweight, interminably bourgeois boat."

links.title: You: ""Funny, I don't see any other *eel'..."
links.text: "Funny, I don't see any other *eel's heels* around."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""You mean *eel's hips* -- but point..."
links.text: "You mean *eel's hips* -- but point taken. I am a bourgeois woman and this is my fast, light, interminably bourgeois boat."

links.title: You: ""There doesn't seem to be much spac..."
links.text: "There doesn't seem to be much space left with this giant pleasure craft docked in the way."

links.title: Rhetoric: "Yup. That's the stuff."
links.text: Yup. That's the stuff.

links.title: You: ""Good thing everyone else has tiny..."
links.text: "Good thing everyone else has tiny skiffs."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""I assure you, they drove quite the..."
links.text: "I assure you, they drove quite the hard bargain for this space -- but you're right."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""I am a bourgeois woman and this is..."
links.text: "I am a bourgeois woman and this is my long, incredibly lightweight, interminably bourgeois boat."

links.title: Reaction Speed: "Uhm..."
links.text: Uhm...

links.title: You: ""Uhm...""
Joyce Messier: "She takes a sip."
links.text: She takes a sip.

links.title: You: ""It's gonna happen.""
links.text: "It's gonna happen."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Okay." She takes a sip."
links.text: "Okay." She takes a sip.

links.title: You: ""Something is about to happen." (Po..."
links.text: "Something is about to happen." (Point to your head.) "In here."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Of course.""
links.text: "Of course."

links.title: You: ""Any moment.""
links.text: "Any moment."

links.title: Reaction Speed: "Nothing happens. For quite a while."
links.text: Nothing happens. For quite a while.

links.title: You: ""They will come from my head -- the..."
links.text: "They will come from my head -- the arguments."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""As they do.""
links.text: "As they do."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""The thoughts happen *inside* his b..."
links.text: "The thoughts happen *inside* his brain," the lieutenant explains.

links.title: You: "Wave your hand next to your head. (..."
links.text: Wave your hand next to your head. (It will help!)

links.title: Reaction Speed: "It doesn't."
links.text: It doesn't.

links.title: You: "Keep waving your hand, slowly."
links.text: Keep waving your hand, slowly.

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""My..." she inspects the motion. "I..."
links.text: "My..." she inspects the motion. "It's as if there is *a tiny spinner* on the side of his head, and he's *reeling* thoughts out."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Except he isn't.""
links.text: "Except he isn't."

links.title: Empathy: "The lieutenant is satisfied with wh..."
links.text: The lieutenant is satisfied with where this is going.

links.title: You: ""A thought is going to come out of..."
links.text: "A thought is going to come out of my head and into my mouth -- and I will say it."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Of course.""
links.text: "Of course."

links.title: You: "Keep doing it."
links.text: Keep doing it.

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Lieutenant, I truly don't understa..."
links.text: "Lieutenant, I truly don't understand what is happening here."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I told you his methods are... unco..."
links.text: "I told you his methods are... unconventional."

links.title: You: ""I swear to god I'm usually sharp...."
links.text: "I swear to god I'm usually sharp. I don't know what happened. Why am I not *killing it*?!"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""You're marbles on glass, dear. Don..."
links.text: "You're marbles on glass, dear. Don't worry."

links.title: You: ""What were we talking about anyway?""
links.text: "What were we talking about anyway?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""It was *quite* a while ago, but I..."
links.text: "It was *quite* a while ago, but I think..." she looks around. "Yes. We were discussing my fast, large, ineluctably middle class boat."

links.title: You: ""Fuck this, I'm outta here." [Leave..."
links.text: "Fuck this, I'm outta here." [Leave.]

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Oh no..." Her eyes turn large and..."
links.text: "Oh no..." Her eyes turn large and round...

links.title: Reaction Speed: "Your hand tires from making the mot..."
links.text: Your hand tires from making the motion.

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""I can see your hand is getting tir..."
links.text: "I can see your hand is getting tired now -- there is no need to continue. No one is keeping score."

links.title: You: ""This isn't gonna happen.""
links.text: "This isn't gonna happen."

links.title: You: ""Nothing is going to come." (Give u..."
links.text: "Nothing is going to come." (Give up.)

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""No worries." She takes another sip..."
links.text: "No worries." She takes another sip. "We can just go back to discussing my fast, large, interminably middle class boat."

links.title: You: ""Fine. Anyway..." (Change the subje..."
links.text: "Fine. Anyway..." (Change the subject.)

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Yes -- anyway." She adjusts her ha..."
links.text: "Yes -- anyway." She adjusts her hair. The permanent wave in her auburn locks radiates victory.

links.title: You: ""Precisomundo. Class war time baby.""
links.text: "Precisomundo. Class war time baby."

links.title: You: ""No -- it's a symbol of our subjuga..."
links.text: "No -- it's a symbol of our subjugation to *foreign* capital. The bad kind of capital."

links.title: You: ""Forget about it. I was out of line.""
links.text: "Forget about it. I was out of line."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Think nothing of it, officer." She..."
links.text: "Think nothing of it, officer." She runs her hand along the fibreglass cabin. "What's a little *class conflict* between friends?"

links.title: You: ""Not a lot of people on boats, are..."
links.text: "Not a lot of people on boats, are there?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Of course there are." She looks ar..."
links.text: "Of course there are." She looks around. "We are on an archipelago. How else are you supposed to get around?"

links.title: Empathy: "There is a pinch of *defensiveness*..."
links.text: There is a pinch of *defensiveness* in her voice, but it is playful.

links.title: You: ""Wait, we're on an *archipelago*?"..."
links.text: "Wait, we're on an *archipelago*?" (Look around.)

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Yes, we are." She raises her brow...."
links.text: "Yes, we are." She raises her brow. "We are on Le Caillou."

links.title: Encyclopedia: "Technically, the neighbouring Ozonn..."
links.text: Technically, the neighbouring Ozonne and Face-à-La-Mer island groups are archipelagos, while Le Caillou, by contrast, is a single, fertile land mass, the fourth largest island in the world. It is not an archipelago.

links.title: You: ""Uhm, Caillou? I thought we were in..."
links.text: "Uhm, Caillou? I thought we were in Revachol."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""We are. And the city of Revachol i..."
links.text: "We are. And the city of Revachol is on the island of Le Caillou."

links.title: You: ""Wait, I thought Le Calliou was one..."
links.text: "Wait, I thought Le Calliou was one big island?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Okay." She gives you a crooked smi..."
links.text: "Okay." She gives you a crooked smile. "If you want to get technical. The point is we're *all* on islands here. And sail is still the most expedient way to get from one island to another. Especially when you're in a hurry to resolve a *strike*."

links.title: You: ""Still. I haven't seen anyone else..."
links.text: "Still. I haven't seen anyone else sail a boat around here."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""I haven't seen anyone else drive a..."
links.text: "I haven't seen anyone else drive a souped-up Coupris Kineema motor carriage either."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Actually," the lieutenant becomes..."
links.text: "Actually," the lieutenant becomes defensive, "that motor carriage has been specially issued to serve as a patrol and *pursuit* vehicle."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""It's for crossing long distances i..."
links.text: "It's for crossing long distances in the Greater Revachol Industrial Harbour. It's not a toy."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Neither is this." The woman pats t..."
links.text: "Neither is this." The woman pats the cabin hardtop. "A toy, I mean. It's a machine for crossing long distances in the bay of Revachol. Between the city and the islands."

links.title: Logic: "She's referring to Lieutenant Kitsu..."
links.text: She's referring to Lieutenant Kitsuragi's motor carriage.

links.title: You: ""That's not mine. It belongs to my..."
links.text: "That's not mine. It belongs to my partner, Lieutenant Kitsuragi."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""No matter *whose* it is. A motor c..."
links.text: "No matter *whose* it is. A motor carriage is just a tool. You need it to do your job -- as I do mine. It's just a means of getting where you need to go."

links.title: You: ""I drove my motor carriage into the..."
links.text: "I drove my motor carriage into the sea, you know. It sank."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""What a surprise," she says, not th..."
links.text: "What a surprise," she says, not the least bit surprised. "That is one disadvantage of a motor carriage relative to a sloop like this one." The sloop bobs gently in the water.

links.title: You: "Let it be."
links.text: Let it be.

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""In any case..." She takes a sip fr..."
links.text: "In any case..." She takes a sip from her thermal cup.

links.title: You: ""There it is again -- the name of t..."
links.text: "There it is again -- the name of that infernal machine! I woke up to that sound, you know?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Hmm, I suppose that one *does* hav..."
links.text: "Hmm, I suppose that one *does* have a rather loud electrical engine." She does not quite understand what you meant. "A specific drone. In any case...."

links.title: You: ""You lost me there -- I have no ide..."
links.text: "You lost me there -- I have no idea what a Coupris Kineema is."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Pardon me, it's not especially rel..."
links.text: "Pardon me, it's not especially relevant."

links.title: You: ""Understood. About this boat of you..."
links.text: "Understood. About this boat of yours..." (Back off.)

links.title: Joyce Messier: "She nods attentively."
links.text: She nods attentively.

links.title: You: ""What do you mean -- archipelago?""
links.text: "What do you mean -- archipelago?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""I *mean* we are on Le Caillou, are..."
links.text: "I *mean* we are on Le Caillou, are we not?" She raises her brow.

links.title: You: ""Does she have a name?""
links.text: "Does she have a name?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""The boat? No. *It* is called Cor-d..."
links.text: "The boat? No. *It* is called Cor-de-Leite '19 -- because that's the type of sloop it is."

links.title: Inland Empire: "The word *it* feels strange. Such a..."
links.text: The word *it* feels strange. Such a beautiful boat deserves a proper name...

links.title: Shivers: "A breeze ripples through the sails..."
links.text: A breeze ripples through the sails and tugs at your hair. Below, the sleek, fishlike shape of the hull parts the water. Beneath that -- a resounding darkness. You're reminded of something, or some*one*...

links.title: You: ""Cool, but your boat really needs a..."
links.text: "Cool, but your boat really needs a name."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Okay. How about Cor-de-Leite '19...."
links.text: "Okay. How about Cor-de-Leite '19. Why?" She taps on the side of the boat, it makes a hollow sound....

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Because it was manufactured in Rev..."
links.text: "Because it was manufactured in Revachol East by a company called Cor-de-Leite, and it's hull is '19 paces long."

links.title: Conceptualization: "She makes a point of being unromant..."
links.text: She makes a point of being unromantic about it.

links.title: You: ""How about the *Sleek Fish*.""
links.text: "How about the *Sleek Fish*."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""What?""
links.text: "What?"

links.title: You: ""Because it's sleek... and fish-lik..."
links.text: "Because it's sleek... and fish-like."

links.title: Joyce Messier: "A smirk passes her face. "I think I..."
links.text: A smirk passes her face. "I think I'll stick with the factory name. But thank you."

links.title: You: ""How about the *Ex-* something.""
links.text: "How about the *Ex-* something."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""The *Ex-* something? The *Ex-* wha..."
links.text: "The *Ex-* something? The *Ex-* what?"

links.title: You: ""The *Executor*!""
links.text: "The *Executor*!"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Oh, I *do* like the sound of that...."
links.text: "Oh, I *do* like the sound of that." A smirk passes her face. "It sounds so *decisive*, so..."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""*Powerful*...""
links.text: "*Powerful*..."

links.title: Rhetoric: "She's not actually considering it...."
links.text: She's not actually considering it. It's sarcasm.

links.title: You: ""The *Ex-Wife*.""
links.text: "The *Ex-Wife*."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Thank you for the suggestion. I se..."
links.text: "Thank you for the suggestion. I see the word has emotional resonance for you. For me, sadly -- none. So I will stick with the factory name."

links.title: You: ""Just the *Ex-Something*.""
links.text: "Just the *Ex-Something*."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Very absurd," she nods. "Thank you..."
links.text: "Very absurd," she nods. "Thank you for the suggestion. I will stick with the factory name for now -- but thank you."

links.title: You: ""How about... Dolores.""
links.text: "How about... Dolores."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Why *Dolores*?""
links.text: "Why *Dolores*?"

links.title: Pain Threshold: "Because it *stings*. In an ancient..."
links.text: Because it *stings*. In an ancient and beautiful way.

links.title: You: ""I don't know... feels pretty.""
links.text: "I don't know... feels pretty."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Hmm. Well, it means nothing to me...."
links.text: "Hmm. Well, it means nothing to me. I think I'll stick with the factory name. But thank you for the suggestion."

links.title: You: ""I just like the name for some reas..."
links.text: "I just like the name for some reason."

links.title: You: ""After Her Innocence Dolores Dei.""
links.text: "After Her Innocence Dolores Dei."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""I'm not really *big* on moralist s..."
links.text: "I'm not really *big* on moralist symbols. I think I'll stick with the factory name. But thank you."

links.title: You: ""Okay, but what *kind* of boat is i..."
links.text: "Okay, but what *kind* of boat is it?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""It's a pleasure craft. A nineteen-..."
links.text: "It's a pleasure craft. A nineteen-pacer. It also happens to be rated for Category 1 racing. Though these days I mainly use it for business..."

links.title: You: ""How do you like it?" (Conclude.)"
links.text: "How do you like it?" (Conclude.)

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""My sloop? I like it a lot." Her li..."
links.text: "My sloop? I like it a lot." Her lips curl into a wry smile. "It's the *eel's hips*, baby."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I'm enjoying this part of the inte..."
links.text: "I'm enjoying this part of the interview -- it has *so* little to do with the murder we're investigating."

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "I really do, the lieutenant thinks..."
links.text: I really do, the lieutenant thinks -- is she thrown off, yet? He's looking at the woman, assessing her...

links.title: You: ""Do you have a licence for this boa..."
links.text: "Do you have a licence for this boat?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Officer, I assure you I'm a highly..."
links.text: "Officer, I assure you I'm a highly qualified pleasure craft operator."

links.title: Perception (Sight): "The crowns of her teeth are porcela..."
links.text: The crowns of her teeth are porcelain, white as the boat's hull as she smiles.

links.title: Half Light: "*Qualified pleasure craft operator*..."
links.text: *Qualified pleasure craft operator*... so charming. Where's the damn licence?

links.title: You: ""Can I see your licence?""
links.text: "Can I see your licence?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""I just renewed its safety inspecti..."
links.text: "I just renewed its safety inspection last month, officer. It is completely seaworthy. In fact, it's taken part in not one, but *two* Insulindic regattas, and finished once."

links.title: You: ""What happened the other time?""
links.text: "What happened the other time?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""The other time I *would* have fini..."
links.text: "The other time I *would* have finished the race were it not for an urgent work matter, much like the one I'm on now."

links.title: You: ""Still *need* to see a license, ma'..."
links.text: "Still *need* to see a license, ma'am."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Actually, you don't.""
links.text: "Actually, you don't."

links.title: You: ""I'm pretty sure I do. I police.""
links.text: "I'm pretty sure I do. I police."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""It is a little known fact among th..."
links.text: "It is a little known fact among those who *police* that the Wayfarer Act specifically denies the RCM the authority to demand anyone's operator license."

links.title: Encyclopedia: "The Wayfarer Act is one of the few..."
links.text: The Wayfarer Act is one of the few pieces of legislation governing human interaction in the Revachol Zone of Control, along with the Emergency Trade and Aliments Acts.

links.title: You: "The what now?"
links.text: The what now?

links.title: Encyclopedia: "It's one of the foundational laws i..."
links.text: It's one of the foundational laws in Revachol, designed to limit the authority of local institutions. Part of it prohibits the RCM from requesting most documents and licenses without permission from a Coalition representative...

links.title: Rhetoric: "It's a law that keeps Revachol what..."
links.text: It's a law that keeps Revachol what it is -- in limbo.

links.title: You: "*Yawn*"
links.text: *Yawn*

links.title: Encyclopedia: "The one time this busted up cabbage..."
links.text: The one time this busted up cabbage has something useful for your *job* you just want to stare at some boat. Fine. Knock yourself out.

links.title: You: ""Wait, exactly how little known is..."
links.text: "Wait, exactly how little known is this fact?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I was just being polite -- even sc..."
links.text: "I was just being polite -- even schoolchildren know the Wayfarer Act."

links.title: You: ""More like the Anarchy Act in my op..."
links.text: "More like the Anarchy Act in my opinion."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""No need to politicize this. You ma..."
links.text: "No need to politicize this. You may still ask for the lady's *passport*."

links.title: Authority: "You need to save face if you want h..."
links.text: You need to save face if you want her respect. DEMAND that passport!

links.title: You: ""No need.""
links.text: "No need."

links.title: Joyce Messier: "She nods politely. "Of course. Any..."
links.text: She nods politely. "Of course. Any more questions about the boat, sir?"

links.title: Suggestion: "The graciousness of her response ma..."
links.text: The graciousness of her response makes you feel glad you didn't hassle her about her papers for no reason.

links.title: You: ""So we *can't* pull over random civ..."
links.text: "So we *can't* pull over random civilians and demand their papers? That's weak."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Unless it's their *passport*, no...."
links.text: "Unless it's their *passport*, no. Do you want to ask for the lady's passport?"

links.title: You: ""Makes sense, I guess. I mean, look..."
links.text: "Makes sense, I guess. I mean, look at me!"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""No need to resort to self pity, de..."
links.text: "No need to resort to self pity, detective. You can still ask for her passport."

links.title: You: ""Okay, forget the stupid Wayfarer A..."
links.text: "Okay, forget the stupid Wayfarer Act. I had another question..." (Back off.)

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""About the boat?" A wisp of steam r..."
links.text: "About the boat?" A wisp of steam rises from her thermal cup.

links.title: You: ""More like Anarchy Act in my opinio..."
links.text: "More like Anarchy Act in my opinion."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""You may still ask to see my passpo..."
links.text: "You may still ask to see my passport," she says, trying to strike a conciliatory tone. "*That* I'm obliged to share with you."

links.title: You: ""Yes. I'm going to need to see your..."
links.text: "Yes. I'm going to need to see your passport."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Of course." She searches the pocke..."
links.text: "Of course." She searches the pockets of her raincoat, producing a bundle of documents in a sealed plastic bag.

links.title: You: ""So I can't arbitrarily pull people..."
links.text: "So I can't arbitrarily pull people over and ask for their papers?"

links.title: You: ""Makes sense, I guess. I mean, look..."
links.text: "Makes sense, I guess. I mean, look at me."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""You may still ask for my passport...."
links.text: "You may still ask for my passport." She strikes a reconciliatory tone...

links.title: Empathy: "Laced with just a touch of pity."
links.text: Laced with just a touch of pity.

links.title: You: ""Huh, interesting. I had another qu..."
links.text: "Huh, interesting. I had another question..."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""About the boat?" A wisp of steam r..."
links.text: "About the boat?" A wisp of steam rises from her thermal cup.

links.title: You: ""What do you mean?""
links.text: "What do you mean?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""The Wayfarer Act specifically deni..."
links.text: "The Wayfarer Act specifically denies the RCM the authority to demand anyone's operator license. It's a *little known fact* among us law officials."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Technically speaking, you *don't*.""
links.text: "Technically speaking, you *don't*."

links.title: You: ""I'm pretty sure I do. I police.""
links.text: "I'm pretty sure I do. I police."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Then certainly you must know that..."
links.text: "Then certainly you must know that under the Wayfarer Act the RCM doesn't have the authority to demand anyone's operator license. Freedom of movement and all that."

links.title: You: ""What do you mean?""
links.text: "What do you mean?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Surely you're aware that under the..."
links.text: "Surely you're aware that under the Wayfarer Act the RCM doesn't have the authority to demand anyone's operator license. Freedom of movement and all that."

links.title: You: ""That's good enough for me.""
links.text: "That's good enough for me."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Why wouldn't it be? This is Revach..."
links.text: "Why wouldn't it be? This is Revachol. Wayfarer act and all. *Anyone* can drive a boat."

links.title: Encyclopedia: "Her nonchalance *might* be related..."
links.text: Her nonchalance *might* be related to something called the Wayfarer Act -- a law that says she doesn't *need* a licence. Sly fox... you're not aggressive enough to harass her further on this.

links.title: You: ""I think I have a handle on the boa..."
links.text: "I think I have a handle on the boat thing." (Conclude.)

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Good," she takes a sip of her ther..."
links.text: "Good," she takes a sip of her thermal cup.

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""What would you like to know?" She..."
links.text: "What would you like to know?" She taps her foot on the deck.

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Why, yes I am..." She looks at the..."
links.text: "Why, yes I am..." She looks at the deck under her feet. Green and white sails flutter overhead.

links.title: You: ""Tell me about Wild Pines. What do..."
links.text: "Tell me about Wild Pines. What do you do?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""What *we* do -- I'm afraid I don't..."
links.text: "What *we* do -- I'm afraid I don't speak for Wild Pines as a whole. It's a giant undertaking."

links.title: Rhetoric: "There was a touch of discomfort the..."
links.text: There was a touch of discomfort there. She wants to merely *represent*.

links.title: You: ""So what do *they* do?""
links.text: "So what do *they* do?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""The Pines' *core competency* is lo..."
links.text: "The Pines' *core competency* is logistics -- container shipping, freight, that sort of thing." She points to the small dots on the horizon. "See those airships there, blinking? Those are the shipping side of things..."

links.title: Joyce Messier: "...then to the east, toward the har..."
links.text: ...then to the east, toward the harbour: "And that is the terminal. Another subdivision deals with energy -- oil and gas exploration. Offshore platforms."

links.title: Encyclopedia: "The Wild Pines Group is one of the..."
links.text: The Wild Pines Group is one of the original Revacholian *indotribes* -- companies awarded royal monopolies by the king (the suzerain) himself, centuries ago. The king is long gone, but several of the indotribes remain.

links.title: Suggestion: "She enjoys talking about the compan..."
links.text: She enjoys talking about the company. It would not hurt to inquire more.

links.title: You: "Who are the other indotribes?"
links.text: Who are the other indotribes?

links.title: Encyclopedia: "Saint-Batiste, LUM, an unknown enti..."
links.text: Saint-Batiste, LUM, an unknown entity known as Brightest Star...

links.title: You: ""You're in *good* company, it seems.""
links.text: "You're in *good* company, it seems."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Why, thank you." She does not regi..."
links.text: "Why, thank you." She does not register the real meaning of the remark.

links.title: You: ""How much money does Wild Pines hav..."
links.text: "How much money does Wild Pines have?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""I'm not at liberty to discuss the..."
links.text: "I'm not at liberty to discuss the company balance sheet, but I *can* tell you that last year the company booked more than 20 billion reál in revenue."

links.title: Encyclopedia: "A... billion?"
links.text: A... billion?

links.title: You: ""What exactly is a *billion*?""
links.text: "What exactly is a *billion*?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""It's a number, officer, a *big* on..."
links.text: "It's a number, officer, a *big* one."

links.title: You: ""What is it made of?""
links.text: "What is it made of?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""It's made of one thousand millions..."
links.text: "It's made of one thousand millions -- a million is made of a thousand thousands."

links.title: You: ""Wow.""
links.text: "Wow."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Twenty billion is a large number,..."
links.text: "Twenty billion is a large number, but the conglomerate employs 72,000 people. They all need to be paid. Then there are capital improvements, interest payments..." A wave hits the sloop, she grasps the mainstay for balance.

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""A conglomerate the size of the Wil..."
links.text: "A conglomerate the size of the Wild Pines is like a shark -- if it stops moving it will die. Then what becomes of those 72,000 families? It's a tremendous responsibility."

links.title: You: ""Where does Wild Pines *get* all th..."
links.text: "Where does Wild Pines *get* all these billions?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""They started as an exploration and..."
links.text: "They started as an exploration and cargo fleet conducting trade between the Samaran and Insulindian isolas -- 250 years ago, when Pines' ships explored the South-Semenese and charted Lo Manthang on behalf of the suzerain."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Centuries of care, deliberation --..."
links.text: "Centuries of care, deliberation -- and *madness* -- have gone into this endeavour. Vessels pass through the Great Unrest to re-emerge with apricots in tow. The logic of the system is totalizing... It's taken *everything* from its employees to build it."

links.title: You: ""It probably helps to start out wit..."
links.text: "It probably helps to start out with a royal monopoly."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""You know more than you let on." Sh..."
links.text: "You know more than you let on." She takes a sip and looks you over afresh. "Certainly it helped, but most of the original indotribes have failed or been absorbed. To survive Wild Pines had to grow and adapt. No suzerain did that."

links.title: You: ""What does such a huge system want..."
links.text: "What does such a huge system want with a place like this?" (Look around.)

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""You mean aside from being the term..."
links.text: "You mean aside from being the terminal's legal owners?" She gives you a little smile. "Who are responsible for moving *eight* percent of the world's cargo?"

links.title: You: ""Eight percent of *all* cargo in th..."
links.text: "Eight percent of *all* cargo in the world? That's quite the endeavour indeed."

links.title: Joyce Messier: "She nods, forcefully: "There are no..."
links.text: She nods, forcefully: "There are no minor cogs in the system. Each terminal must be accounted for, lest the entire system break. Every hiccup in such a system means thousands lose their jobs -- the world over. I'm here to assure that doesn't happen."

links.title: Suggestion: "With your help -- hopefully -- says..."
links.text: With your help -- hopefully -- says her warm tone.

links.title: You: ""You don't keep it moving -- the wo..."
links.text: "You don't keep it moving -- the workers do. The company is nothing without them."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""We built this district," she says,..."
links.text: "We built this district," she says, calmly.

links.title: Rhetoric: "*We* -- there it is. She owns up to..."
links.text: *We* -- there it is. She owns up to it.

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""All the best parts of it. Rue de S..."
links.text: "All the best parts of it. Rue de Saint-Ghislaine with its bastions, the plaza's Meteoran mosaic. Even some of the old street lamps have been put back thanks to investments from the WP." She points behind you where the seawall rises.

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Before Martinaise was swallowed by..."
links.text: "Before Martinaise was swallowed by the industrial harbour, even before it was part of Revachol -- long before Terminal B was erected here -- the Pines built it as a resort for its Revacholian employees."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""A company getaway. For a weekend o..."
links.text: "A company getaway. For a weekend or a summer holiday. Then came the Revolution, but that's another matter..." She takes a sip. "I'm here to make sure the Pines can fulfil their responsibilities to the place they *built*."

links.title: You: ""That's all I needed to know -- abo..."
links.text: "That's all I needed to know -- about something else..."

links.title: You: ""That's *it*? I thought Wild Pines..."
links.text: "That's *it*? I thought Wild Pines was supposed to be big time."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""And to think -- there are years wh..."
links.text: "And to think -- there are years when the group books *losses* in the billions..." A wave hits the sloop, she grasps the mainstay for balance.

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Wild Pines employs 72,000 people,..."
links.text: "Wild Pines employs 72,000 people, all of whom have families that depend on their salaries. It is a tremendous responsibility."

links.title: You: ""Numbers like that mean nothing to..."
links.text: "Numbers like that mean nothing to me."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Yes, past a certain point numbers..."
links.text: "Yes, past a certain point numbers begin to seem *imaginary*. But they are quite real for the 72,000 employees who depend on Wild Pines for their pay checks..."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""A conglomerate the size of Wild Pi..."
links.text: "A conglomerate the size of Wild Pines is like a shark -- if it stops moving and growing it will die. Then what becomes of those 72,000 families? It is a tremendous responsibility."

links.title: You: ""The money I owe is *so much* less..."
links.text: "The money I owe is *so much* less than that."

links.title: You: ""Got it. Tell me something else.""
links.text: "Got it. Tell me something else."

links.title: You: ""Fair enough. Tell me something els..."
links.text: "Fair enough. Tell me something else."

links.title: Joyce Messier: "She nods."
links.text: She nods.

links.title: You: ""What can you tell me about this st..."
links.text: "What can you tell me about this strike?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Of course." She takes a sip from t..."
links.text: "Of course." She takes a sip from the thermal cup.

links.title: You: ""What happened to this... Gaumont?""
links.text: "What happened to this... Gaumont?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Mr. Claire told him to, how did he..."
links.text: "Mr. Claire told him to, how did he put it?" She pauses to compose herself...

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""'Fuck off, midget.' Gaumont is sho..."
links.text: "'Fuck off, midget.' Gaumont is short of stature, you see."

links.title: You: ""Hmh. Okay then.""
links.text: "Hmh. Okay then."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Yes. Keep in mind, this is a negot..."
links.text: "Yes. Keep in mind, this is a negotiator Mr. Claire has worked with before, and who was more than fair with him and the Union."

links.title: You: ""Cool.""
links.text: "Cool."

links.title: You: ""*Not* cool.""
links.text: "*Not* cool."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Keep in mind, this is a negotiator..."
links.text: "Keep in mind, this is a negotiator Mr. Claire has worked with before, and who was more than fair with him and the Union."

links.title: You: ""What are their demands?""
links.text: "What are their demands?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""There are leaflets everywhere, and..."
links.text: "There are leaflets everywhere, and banners... what did they say again? Oh, yes..."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""*EVERY WORKER -- A MEMBER OF THE B..."
links.text: "*EVERY WORKER -- A MEMBER OF THE BOARD!*"

links.title: Logic: "Most of the workers probably don't..."
links.text: Most of the workers probably don't know what that means.

links.title: You: ""I like it.""
links.text: "I like it."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Then you might also like their oth..."
links.text: "Then you might also like their other slogan: 'DEMAND DEMOCRACY!'"

links.title: You: ""Oh, yeah. That's a good one.""
links.text: "Oh, yeah. That's a good one."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Personally, I don't think it has t..."
links.text: "Personally, I don't think it has the same *pizzazzo* as *EVERY WORKER -- a MEMBER OF THE BOARD*."

links.title: You: ""Nope. That's weak.""
links.text: "Nope. That's weak."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Personally, I agree -- It lacks th..."
links.text: "Personally, I agree -- It lacks the *pizzazzo* of *EVERY WORKER -- A MEMBER OF THE BOARD*."

links.title: You: ""Not *hard communist* enough for me.""
links.text: "Not *hard communist* enough for me."

links.title: You: ""I don't know what to think about t..."
links.text: "I don't know what to think about that."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Fortunately they explained it. Eve..."
links.text: "Fortunately they explained it. Every time the Wild Pines Group makes a decision -- about *anything* -- it needs the signature of *each* of the 2,200 workers in its Martinaise terminal."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Just so you understand, this is bu..."
links.text: "Just so you understand, this is but one of *twenty-two* terminals owned by Wild Pines. Essentially -- not only are they *kings* of the company, they are also kings of the 72,000 employees of Wild Pines Group."

links.title: Rhetoric: "An opening gambit, surely."
links.text: An opening gambit, surely.

links.title: You: ""That's pretty funny, I have to adm..."
links.text: "That's pretty funny, I have to admit."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""They are having a blast -- but how..."
links.text: "They are having a blast -- but how can they *afford* it? After four months my assumption was they would prefer a more *practical* solution."

links.title: You: ""The workers can't be kings. The ki..."
links.text: "The workers can't be kings. The king is king."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""That may well be. It's not up to m..."
links.text: "That may well be. It's not up to me to decide who is king. But as negotiations go -- it's not a swell start."

links.title: You: ""The king is dead. Long live the wo..."
links.text: "The king is dead. Long live the workers!"

links.title: You: ""Sounds like an opening gambit." (P..."
links.text: "Sounds like an opening gambit." (Proceed.)

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""So I hoped." She nods. "But this t..."
links.text: "So I hoped." She nods. "But this type of opening is usually followed by a more reasonable offer. I have yet to hear one, just the same nonsensical slogan repeated over and over again..."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""And *now* people are getting *lync..."
links.text: "And *now* people are getting *lynched*, I hear. Behind the Whirling-in-Rags... a disastrous situation if there ever was one."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Excuse me," the lieutenant looks u..."
links.text: "Excuse me," the lieutenant looks up from his notes, "From whom did you *hear* about this lynching?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""I first heard it from the *boia* a..."
links.text: "I first heard it from the *boia* at the gates,” her reply comes quick, “the one who's very name advertises his aversion to work. I think he said it was *Call Me Mañana*."

links.title: Reaction Speed: "This checks out."
links.text: This checks out.

links.title: Logic: "No, wait. The chief negotiator hear..."
links.text: No, wait. The chief negotiator heard it from a man at the gates? Surely the Wild Pines Group has more effective channels of information. After all, 2,200 people are on strike -- this is a big deal for them.

links.title: You: ""What are you going to do?" (Procee..."
links.text: "What are you going to do?" (Proceed.)

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""I'm not sure. Naturally I assumed..."
links.text: "I'm not sure. Naturally I assumed that was just their opening position, a hard-nosed tactic with a side of mockery. But there's been no follow up, just the same nonsensical slogan repeated over and over again..."

links.title: You: ""Over-aggressive commie posturing.""
links.text: "Over-aggressive commie posturing."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""In its defence, another said *DEMA..."
links.text: "In its defence, another said *DEMAND DEMOCRACY*. Pretty tame stuff compared to *EVERY WORKER -- A MEMBER OF THE BOARD*."

links.title: You: ""What exactly do they mean by it, t..."
links.text: "What exactly do they mean by it, though? What's the demand?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""It's quite simple, you see. Every..."
links.text: "It's quite simple, you see. Every time the Wild Pines Group makes a decision -- about, what? About *anything* really -- it needs the signature of *each* of the 2,200 workers in its Martinaise terminal."

links.title: You: ""What does that even mean?""
links.text: "What does that even mean?"

links.title: You: ""Most of them probably don't know w..."
links.text: "Most of them probably don't know what that means."

links.title: You: ""Seems like they have no idea about..."
links.text: "Seems like they have no idea about business."

links.title: You: ""Forget it. I wanted to ask somethi..."
links.text: "Forget it. I wanted to ask something else about the strike."

links.title: Joyce Messier: "She nods."
links.text: She nods.

links.title: You: ""The scabs at the gate -- did you p..."
links.text: "The scabs at the gate -- did you put them there?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""The... *scabs*?" She raises her br..."
links.text: "The... *scabs*?" She raises her brow. "You mean the huddled masses of Jamrock, come to plead for work where the Union refuses to?"

links.title: Reaction Speed: "Don't let her answer it herself."
links.text: Don't let her answer it herself.

links.title: You: ""No, I mean scabs.""
links.text: "No, I mean scabs."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""To answer your question -- yes. Th..."
links.text: "To answer your question -- yes. They were organized by Wild Pines. The contractors picked them up from Jamrock and drove them over. This is standard practice. The company reserves a right to man its stations."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""If these *workers* were organized..."
links.text: "If these *workers* were organized by Wild Pines or its affiliates, then it would be a company secret. I could not share it with you -- not yet, at least."

links.title: You: ""Let's call them strikebreakers --..."
links.text: "Let's call them strikebreakers -- you put them there, right?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""If these *strikebreakers* were org..."
links.text: "If these *strikebreakers* were organized by Wild Pines or its affiliates, then it would be a company secret. I could not share it with you -- not yet, at least."

links.title: You: ""You're right, I don't know what go..."
links.text: "You're right, I don't know what got into me. Some of that degenerate dock worker lingo has rubbed off, it seems."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Ha!" She gives you a crooked smile..."
links.text: "Ha!" She gives you a crooked smile. "If the workers were organized by Wild Pines then it would be a company secret. I could not share it with you  -- not yet, at least..."

links.title: You: "Let her continue."
links.text: Let her continue.

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Yes. They were organized by Wild P..."
links.text: "Yes. They were organized by Wild Pines. The contractors picked them up from Jamrock and drove them over. This is standard practice. The company reserves a right to man its stations."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""If they were organized by Wild Pin..."
links.text: "If they were organized by Wild Pines or its affiliates then it would be a company secret. I could not share it with you -- not right now at least..."

links.title: Rhetoric: "It's implied she's open to discussi..."
links.text: It's implied she's open to discussing this matter with you at a later occasion.

links.title: You: ""Tell me about this Union boss -- M..."
links.text: "Tell me about this Union boss -- Mr. Claire."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Evrart Claire is a man of the *utm..."
links.text: "Evrart Claire is a man of the *utmost* integrity. If you can say one thing about him, it's that he always puts the interests of the workers first."

links.title: Rhetoric: "She's being sarcastic. Don't take h..."
links.text: She's being sarcastic. Don't take her performance literally.

links.title: You: ""Really?""
links.text: "Really?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Of course not. Evrart is *fantasti..."
links.text: "Of course not. Evrart is *fantastically* corrupt. I imagine he has a thick, viscous goo where you and I have blood."

links.title: Hand/Eye Coordination: "If you were to prick him with somet..."
links.text: If you were to prick him with something sharp you could see it oozing out -- a knife, maybe? No -- a rapier!

links.title: You: ""You sound like you're about to tak..."
links.text: "You sound like you're about to take a rapier to him."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Oh heavens no! We get along just f..."
links.text: "Oh heavens no! We get along just fine... Yet now that you mention it, I can't stop imagining that black treacle... Just dribbling down his double chin..." She stops and smiles.

links.title: You: ""That's Evrart, alright.""
links.text: "That's Evrart, alright."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""He is the most corrupt individual..."
