links.text: "He is the most corrupt individual I have ever seen. And I deal with men like him for a living. If there is anyone more venal, more irredeemably nepotistic -- then it's his twin brother, Edgar."

links.title: You: ""I remember hearing something about..."
links.text: "I remember hearing something about this Edgar."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Have you *seen* him?""
links.text: "Have you *seen* him?"

links.title: You: ""No.""
links.text: "No."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Edgar looks *exactly* like his bro..."
links.text: "Edgar looks *exactly* like his brother, except for that lazy eye. He also *talks* exactly like Evrart does. And when one's term as foreman is up, the other takes over."

links.title: You: ""I'd rather you tell me about somet..."
links.text: "I'd rather you tell me about something else."

links.title: You: ""Wait, there are *two* of him?""
links.text: "Wait, there are *two* of him?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Yes. Edgar looks *exactly* like hi..."
links.text: "Yes. Edgar looks *exactly* like his brother, except for that lazy eye. He also *talks* exactly like Evrart does. And when one's term as foreman is up, the other takes over."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""It's how they circumvent the term..."
links.text: "It's how they circumvent the term limits, you see. With a funny little *switcharoo*. While in office they've embezzled god knows *how* much of their workers' dues."

links.title: You: ""What about the Union itself, outsi..."
links.text: "What about the Union itself, outside the brothers Claire?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""The Débardeurs' Union was once a p..."
links.text: "The Débardeurs' Union was once a perfectly normal institution. Twenty years ago, anyway. It must *not* have been easy to establish under the Emergency Act, but they did it. I can respect that."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Organized labour at its best, as t..."
links.text: "Organized labour at its best, as they say. Then something happened in the local chapter elections. The Brothers Claire came and transformed it into a... how do you say?" She hesitates, looking for the right expression.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""A mob," the lieutenant says succin..."
links.text: "A mob," the lieutenant says succinctly. "The Débardeurs are a crime syndicate. Sad as it may be, we're forced to cooperate with them."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Refreshingly honest, officer." She..."
links.text: "Refreshingly honest, officer." She nods. "The company has tried appeasing in the past, but I'm afraid our concessions have only emboldened Evrart and his brother." She turns to you:

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""And your opinion, detective? If I..."
links.text: "And your opinion, detective? If I may ask. I'm a curious and talkative person you see," she explains." Would you say the Débardeurs' Union is..."

links.title: You: ""An effective advocate for the righ..."
links.text: "An effective advocate for the rights of local workingmen."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Why do you think so?" Her voice is..."
links.text: "Why do you think so?" Her voice is calm, there is only curiosity there.

links.title: Conceptualization: "What she calls *corruption* is simp..."
links.text: What she calls *corruption* is simply an aesthetic category.

links.title: You: ""Talking in aesthetic categories is..."
links.text: "Talking in aesthetic categories is the privilege of the overclass. From what I've seen -- most people are just trying to survive."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Point taken." She falls silent. Th..."
links.text: "Point taken." She falls silent. The crow's feet in the corner of her eye deepen. She looks to the city behind you, then to the coast. "But enough about Evrart -- what else can I do for you?"

links.title: You: ""Between Evrart the Human Leech and..."
links.text: "Between Evrart the Human Leech and Measurehead, this Union sounds like a *motley crew*. I'm into it." (Wink.)

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Well..." She looks across the bay,..."
links.text: "Well..." She looks across the bay, trying to find the words. "I suppose that's *one* way to look at it -- they're an interesting composition, albeit vile. But enough about Evrart -- what else can I do for you?"

links.title: You: ""Sounds like they're All-Revachol...."
links.text: "Sounds like they're All-Revachol. I'm All-Revachol, too. To hell with the rest."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Ha!" She lets out a loud cackle. "..."
links.text: "Ha!" She lets out a loud cackle. "I suppose you are, officer. *All*-Revachol. But enough about Evrart -- what else can I tell you about?"

links.title: You: ""They're good labour men. Can't fau..."
links.text: "They're good labour men. Can't fault them for a little *corruption*."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Ha!" She throws her hair back. "A..."
links.text: "Ha!" She throws her hair back. "A real Man of the Left. What else can I tell you about?"

links.title: You: ""A giant leech sucking the life out..."
links.text: "A giant leech sucking the life out of Revachol."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Or a mob." She nods. "Sadly, Wild..."
links.text: "Or a mob." She nods. "Sadly, Wild Pines have cooperated with what amounts to a crime syndicate for two decades. However much you feed the wolf -- the wolf always hungers."

links.title: You: ""Basically a socialist mob.""
links.text: "Basically a socialist mob."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Thank you for being candid," she n..."
links.text: "Thank you for being candid," she nods. "Sadly, Wild Pines have cooperated with what amounts to a crime syndicate for two decades. However much you feed the wolf -- the wolf always hungers."

links.title: You: ""I prefer not to have an opinion on..."
links.text: "I prefer not to have an opinion on these things."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Of course, officer.""
links.text: "Of course, officer."

links.title: You: ""Let's take this back to the strike.""
links.text: "Let's take this back to the strike."

links.title: You: ""He's not *that* bad.""
links.text: "He's not *that* bad."

links.title: You: ""Is he that bad?""
links.text: "Is he that bad?"

links.title: You: ""He can't be that bad.""
links.text: "He can't be that bad."

links.title: You: "Say nothing."
links.text: Say nothing.

links.title: You: ""Evrart is a hero of the worker's m..."
links.text: "Evrart is a hero of the worker's movement."

links.title: You: ""That's not what you really think,..."
links.text: "That's not what you really think, right?

links.title: You: ""One more thing -- you said somethi..."
links.text: "One more thing -- you said something *happened* in the elections?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""I'm glad you asked. There was a wo..."
links.text: "I'm glad you asked. There was a woman -- the previous forewoman of the Union. She disappeared."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Disappeared?""
links.text: "Disappeared?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Yes. On the last day of the local..."
links.text: "Yes. On the last day of the local chapter elections her daughter phoned in and said she wasn't running anymore -- or coming to work. Ever. End of story."

links.title: Reaction Speed: "This *forewoman* -- her name?"
links.text: This *forewoman* -- her name?

links.title: You: ""This forewoman? Her name?""
links.text: "This forewoman? Her name?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Sadly, the company records do not..."
links.text: "Sadly, the company records do not even give a name. She's just *forewoman*, in private correspondence: Holly. I don't even know if it's a sur- or given name. And I don't have access to the Unions' files."

links.title: You: ""Eerie.""
links.text: "Eerie."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Downright *haunting* if you ask me..."
links.text: "Downright *haunting* if you ask me. The Wild Pines suspected foul play, but what could they do? It was a Union matter."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""The point of the presentation is -..."
links.text: "The point of the presentation is -- these kinds of things *happen* around the Claires. Watch out when you're dealing with him."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Thank you for your concern, ma'am...."
links.text: "Thank you for your concern, ma'am. We'll be just fine."

links.title: You: ""It happens.""
links.text: "It happens."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Does it?" She arches her brow. "Th..."
links.text: "Does it?" She arches her brow. "The company suspects foul play, but there's nothing they could do, it was a Union matter."

links.title: You: ""Some kind of extortion probably.""
links.text: "Some kind of extortion probably."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Indeed. The company suspects foul..."
links.text: "Indeed. The company suspects foul play, but there's nothing they could do, it was a Union matter."

links.title: You: ""Disappeared?""
links.text: "Disappeared?"

links.title: You: ""That's all I need here. Let's chan..."
links.text: "That's all I need here. Let's change the topic."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Of course." She passes the thermal..."
links.text: "Of course." She passes the thermal cup between her gloved hands. "How else can I help?"

links.title: Authority: "You don't have to tell her you met..."
links.text: You don't have to tell her you met Evrart *right away*. There's time.

links.title: Rhetoric: "Don't tell her you've met Evrart *r..."
links.text: Don't tell her you've met Evrart *right away*. There's time.

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Everything." She smiles. "Right up..."
links.text: "Everything." She smiles. "Right up to -- but not including -- *trade secrets*."

links.title: You: ""Wait -- what if I want to hear abo..."
links.text: "Wait -- what if I want to hear about *trade secrets*?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""First you'd have to repeal the Eme..."
links.text: "First you'd have to repeal the Emergencies Act of Trade and Aliments that gives me the right to silence. It's quite the octopus."

links.title: Encyclopedia: "The octopus that straddles Revachol..."
links.text: The octopus that straddles Revachol. The *Emergencies Act* is the cornerstone of post-war Revachol, inseparable from the world it created.

links.title: You: ""An octopus? I will *slay* it!""
links.text: "An octopus? I will *slay* it!"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Good luck -- It's only kept in pla..."
links.text: "Good luck -- It's only kept in place by the vested interests of half the civilized world, including your own."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""What the ma'am means is that the E..."
links.text: "What the ma'am means is that the Emergencies Act and the RCM both get their authority from the Coalition Government."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""I'm afraid the Emergencies Act was..."
links.text: "I'm afraid the Emergencies Act was put in place by the same Coalition government that leases the RCM the right to police West Revachol."

links.title: You: ""How do I repeal it then?""
links.text: "How do I repeal it then?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Why, by throwing off half a centur..."
links.text: "Why, by throwing off half a century of foreign domination under the Coalition! Unfortunately for you, the Coalition also leases you the right to police West Revachol..."

links.title: Logic: "You'd be shooting yourself in the f..."
links.text: You'd be shooting yourself in the foot, in other words.

links.title: Pain Threshold: "Did someone say *shooting yourself..."
links.text: Did someone say *shooting yourself in the foot*?

links.title: You: ""You would be surprised at the amou..."
links.text: "You would be surprised at the amount of damage I can inflict upon myself."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""I imagine a man like you can take..."
links.text: "I imagine a man like you can take quite the *lashing*." She sizes you up. "But I believe we were talking about the *strike*."

links.title: You: "Leave it alone."
links.text: Leave it alone.

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""But -- I am derailing us. You want..."
links.text: "But -- I am derailing us. You wanted to know about the strike."

links.title: You: ""Wouldn't want to disturb an octopu..."
links.text: "Wouldn't want to disturb an octopus. Better let it be."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""I am glad you see it that way. To..."
links.text: "I am glad you see it that way. To repeal the act would mean *repealing* the Coalition government. The one that leases you the right to police West Revachol..."

links.title: You: ""What is your role in this, precise..."
links.text: "What is your role in this, precisely?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""I believe the official title is Se..."
links.text: "I believe the official title is Senior Labour Negotiator. In practice I'm a grocery clerk. I relay the Union's demands to Wild Pines, and return with Wild Pines' counter-offer..."

links.title: Drama: "No way. She's more. She can make de..."
links.text: No way. She's more. She can make decisions.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""And how are the talks going?""
links.text: "And how are the talks going?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""They're *not*. That's the problem...."
links.text: "They're *not*. That's the problem. The Union stopped all negotiations a week ago. After that awful lynching took place."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Now they won't even let me into th..."
links.text: "Now they won't even let me into the harbour. There's a 2.20 m racist behemoth blocking the gates."

links.title: You: ""You mean Jean-Luc, my Race Mentor?..."
links.text: "You mean Jean-Luc, my Race Mentor? He's a great teacher, a man of *virtù*."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Oh, so you've *met* him." She take..."
links.text: "Oh, so you've *met* him." She takes a sip of tea. "Has he beguiled you with his inane theories?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""My colleague has his peculiarities..."
links.text: "My colleague has his peculiarities. Let's not go into this particular one just yet."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Of course. To each their own.""
links.text: "Of course. To each their own."

links.title: You: ""What do you mean *beguiled*?""
links.text: "What do you mean *beguiled*?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Charmed, enchanted, put under his..."
links.text: "Charmed, enchanted, put under his spell."

links.title: You: ""Yes. They're *wunderbar*.""
links.text: "Yes. They're *wunderbar*."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""They're *nonsense*, a load of trip..."
links.text: "They're *nonsense*, a load of tripe." She tosses back her hair. "But we were on the subject of the talks I believe."

links.title: You: ""*He* didn't do anything. It was th..."
links.text: "*He* didn't do anything. It was the indisputable truth of his theories!"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Funny, I could think of a few ways..."
links.text: "Funny, I could think of a few ways to dispute them." She pauses. "But we digress."

links.title: You: ""Oh, you mean Measurehead?""
links.text: "Oh, you mean Measurehead?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Yes -- Jean-Luc *Measurehead*." Sh..."
links.text: "Yes -- Jean-Luc *Measurehead*." She leans back and rolls her eyes.

links.title: You: ""Tell me more about this *behemoth*.""
links.text: "Tell me more about this *behemoth*."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""What can I say? The Union employs..."
links.text: "What can I say? The Union employs a giant covered in tattoos." She pauses. "A racist giant. I guess that's part of their *big tent* organization now."

links.title: You: ""So the strike is *connected* to th..."
links.text: "So the strike is *connected* to the lynching?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Yes, I believe there is a connecti..."
links.text: "Yes, I believe there is a connection -- but that's a subject for *later*." Her eyes narrow.

links.title: Suggestion: "She is resolute in this, yet you se..."
links.text: She is resolute in this, yet you sense that she *wants* to tell you. You'll have to earn her trust first.

links.title: You: ""How were the talks going before th..."
links.text: "How were the talks going before the lynching?" (Proceed.)

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Let's say I was not making the kin..."
links.text: "Let's say I was not making the kind of progress I'd hoped for when I first arrived..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""And when did you first arrive?""
links.text: "And when did you first arrive?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""I arrived three weeks ago..." She..."
links.text: "I arrived three weeks ago..." She thinks. "Yes, in the middle of February -- the bay was still partially frozen then. I prefer to do these things on-site. Like the RCM."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""But the strike began in *December*..."
links.text: "But the strike began in *December*." He looks at his notes.

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""I wasn't the original negotiator h..."
links.text: "I wasn't the original negotiator here. I took over after Mr. Gaumont hit a wall with Mr. Claire, the Union boss. Mr. Claire refused to speak with Gaumont, despite *concessions* he'd granted the Union in prior negotiations."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""This isn't the first time the Unio..."
links.text: "This isn't the first time the Union has gone on strike?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Heavens, no. There have been *two*..."
links.text: "Heavens, no. There have been *two* prior strikes. Both times the Union won significant concessions -- including overtime pay *and* a medical plan. This time their demands are more... I guess you could say *aggressive*."

links.title: Rhetoric: "Ludicrous, even, it's meant."
links.text: Ludicrous, even, it's meant.

links.title: You: ""What happened then?""
links.text: "What happened then?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""The Union won *significant* conces..."
links.text: "The Union won *significant* concessions -- including overtime pay *and* a medical plan. This time their demands are more... I guess you could say *aggressive*."

links.title: You: ""How long have you been here?""
links.text: "How long have you been here?"

links.title: Reaction Speed: "Wait! She just admitted that the ly..."
links.text: Wait! She just admitted that the lynching and the strike are connected.

links.title: You: ""How are these talks going?""
links.text: "How are these talks going?"

links.title: You: ""I have other questions.""
links.text: "I have other questions."

links.title: Joyce Messier: "She nods: "I hope I can be of help...."
links.text: She nods: "I hope I can be of help."

links.title: You: "(Show her your badge.) "I found my..."
links.text: (Show her your badge.) "I found my badge, by the way."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""By love, you did!" She inspects th..."
links.text: "By love, you did!" She inspects the piece of blue plastic, her eyes scanning from left to right.

links.title: Composure: "Fast, observantly. Like an electron..."
links.text: Fast, observantly. Like an electronic printer.

links.title: Logic: "She is memorizing your badge number..."
links.text: She is memorizing your badge number.

links.title: Joyce Messier: "She hands it back to you. "Pleased..."
links.text: She hands it back to you. "Pleased to meet you, Lieutenant Double-Yefreitor Du Bois. I am glad to see a man of high qualification -- the situation is precarious."

links.title: Joyce Messier: "Seaweed drips from the badge in you..."
links.text: Seaweed drips from the badge in your hand. It smells of fish. "What can I help you with, lieutenant-yefreitor?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""How about you share your informati..."
links.text: "How about you share your information on the lynching -- now that you've seen his badge."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""The goal posts have moved, lieuten..."
links.text: "The goal posts have moved, lieutenant. In the absence of the badge I have informed my employer there will be a probe."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""I cannot rescind that promise." Sh..."
links.text: "I cannot rescind that promise." She smiles apologetically. "To my knowledge, the drivers are still at the roundabout. I will tell you *everything* I know -- when you've finished with them."

links.title: You: ""This was your plan all along.""
links.text: "This was your plan all along."

links.title: Joyce Messier: "She shakes her head vigorously. "My..."
links.text: She shakes her head vigorously. "My plan is to share information. The only way to do that *now* is by telling my employers you've kept your end. Which I hope you will, because let me tell you: we are in *dire* waters."

links.title: Rhetoric: "Meaning: the information she has wi..."
links.text: Meaning: the information she has will raise the stakes in this game.

links.title: Half Light: "How bad can the info she has be?"
links.text: How bad can the info she has be?

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""The sooner the probe is finished t..."
links.text: "The sooner the probe is finished the sooner I can share *crucial* information with you." She takes a sip of tea. "Now, is there anything I can do for you in the meanwhile? Tea, perhaps?"

links.title: You: ""Fair, I guess. The probe will be d..."
links.text: "Fair, I guess. The probe will be done soon."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""I am glad to hear that. Because le..."
links.text: "I am glad to hear that. Because let me tell you: we are in *dire* waters. The sooner the probe is finished the sooner I can share *crucial* information with you."

links.title: Joyce Messier: "She takes a sip of tea. "Now, is th..."
links.text: She takes a sip of tea. "Now, is there anything I can do for you in the meanwhile? Tea, perhaps?"

links.title: You: ""How about you share your informati..."
links.text: "How about you share your information on the lynching -- now that you've seen my badge."

links.title: You: ""Okay then.""
links.text: "Okay then."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""I can't see why it *wouldn't* be o..."
links.text: "I can't see why it *wouldn't* be okay. Now, what can I do for you?"

links.title: Reaction Speed: "This one's a slippery eel."
links.text: This one's a slippery eel.

links.title: You: ""What can you tell me about this ly..."
links.text: "What can you tell me about this lynching?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Of course," her back straightens...."
links.text: "Of course," her back straightens. "Anything to help."

links.title: Empathy: "There is no shame in her voice -- a..."
links.text: There is no shame in her voice -- a touch of sadness, yes -- but no shame.

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""I'm afraid I can't say any more un..."
links.text: "I'm afraid I can't say any more until we've taken care of formal protocol."

links.title: You: "What kind of arrangement would it b..."
links.text: What kind of arrangement would it be?

links.title: Suggestion: "I mean favours for favours. A *dirt..."
links.text: I mean favours for favours. A *dirty* alliance of some sort.

links.title: Logic: "Consider this -- perhaps she has be..."
links.text: Consider this -- perhaps she has been planning it all along? That you convince *yourself* into colluding with her?

links.title: Half Light: "Perhaps she even knew beforehand of..."
links.text: Perhaps she even knew beforehand of your affliction? A sudden pinch of paranoia comes over you...

links.title: You: "How do I negotiate my way out of th..."
links.text: How do I negotiate my way out of this?

links.title: Suggestion: "She's a negotiator. Just float a fa..."
links.text: She's a negotiator. Just float a favour at her. Insinuate.

links.title: You: ""Surely there's some other way to d..."
links.text: "Surely there's some other way to demonstrate my law enforcement credentials."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""I will be frank with you." She put..."
links.text: "I will be frank with you." She puts down her thermal cup. "If I'm going to break protocol I need to be able to justify it to my superiors. They're going to want to see something very *tangible*."

links.title: Suggestion: "You're in, but expect her to drive..."
links.text: You're in, but expect her to drive a hard bargain.

links.title: You: ""Like what?""
links.text: "Like what?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Reports from inside Terminal B sug..."
links.text: "Reports from inside Terminal B suggest it's a hub for the local drug trade. This is an open secret in Martinaise. The Union *controls* the terminal, so it goes to reason..."

links.title: Logic: "She wants you to help her gain leve..."
links.text: She wants you to help her gain leverage to re-start negotiations with the Union.

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""The company has tried looking into..."
links.text: "The company has tried looking into this matter before -- to no avail. Perhaps someone with *your* authority and resources might turn over the right stones?"

links.title: Logic: "Remember those bold, new exotic rev..."
links.text: Remember those bold, new exotic revenue streams Evrart said he was going to fund his harbour with? You should go back and ask him about that.

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""*Or*..." She picks the cup back up..."
links.text: "*Or*..." She picks the cup back up. "You can recover your badge -- though if I may be blunt with you, it sounds like that may be a lost cause."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Detective," the lieutenant closes..."
links.text: "Detective," the lieutenant closes his notebook. "A word in private before we continue."

links.title: You: ""Excuse us for a moment, madam." [L..."
links.text: "Excuse us for a moment, madam." [Leave.]

links.title: Reaction Speed: "... they're profiting from this tra..."
links.text: ... they're profiting from this trade.

links.title: Suggestion: "*Feelings* will guide the way."
links.text: *Feelings* will guide the way.

links.title: You: ""But, madam, I need to know about t..."
links.text: "But, madam, I need to know about this lynching. It's *very* important to me. It's the case I'm solving."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""I assure you it is no small matter..."
links.text: "I assure you it is no small matter for me either. We *all* share the responsibility for disarming this situation -- I hope you have a badge for me as soon as possible."

links.title: You: ""You don't understand. It's not lik..."
links.text: "You don't understand. It's not like a side-case for me. This is my *main thing*."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Trust me, officer, I am *fully com..."
links.text: "Trust me, officer, I am *fully committed* to resolving this impasse. This isn't some *side gig* for me."

links.title: You: ""You have so much else. I have only..."
links.text: "You have so much else. I have only this." (Spread your hands) "This is the entirety of my existence."

links.title: Joyce Messier: "She's silent. The wind flaps the sa..."
links.text: She's silent. The wind flaps the sail above her.

links.title: You: ""This boat, for example. And a home..."
links.text: "This boat, for example. And a home somewhere! I *only* have this case."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Officer..." The carbon fibre hull..."
links.text: "Officer..." The carbon fibre hull creaks.

links.title: You: ""I don't remember *anything* except..."
links.text: "I don't remember *anything* except this lynching. There is only this coast -- and this lynching."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""You know..." she puts her foot on..."
links.text: "You know..." she puts her foot on the guardwire. "I don't mean to sound cold, but if you want something, you have to give something back. *More* than just guilt."

links.title: Suggestion: "You're doing it! Despite your own b..."
links.text: You're doing it! Despite your own best efforts you're still getting in, somehow...

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""I'll be frank with you. If I'm goi..."
links.text: "I'll be frank with you. If I'm going to break protocol, I need to be able to justify it to my superiors. They're going to want to see something *tangible*."

links.title: You: ""Like what?""
links.text: "Like what?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""The Union is conducting drug trade..."
links.text: "The Union is conducting drug trade out of the harbour. It's an open secret in Martinaise. Surely it must not come as a *complete* surprise to the RCM either. Perhaps it's time to look into it?"

links.title: Logic: "Remember those bold, new exotic rev..."
links.text: Remember those bold, new exotic revenue streams Evrart said he was going to fund his harbour with? You should go back and ask him about that.

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""*Or* you can find your badge, whic..."
links.text: "*Or* you can find your badge, which, honestly, seems like a lost cause."

links.title: You: ""This case is what I will be *known..."
links.text: "This case is what I will be *known* by!"

links.title: You: ""You'll never guess what I found. M..."
links.text: "You'll never guess what I found. My badge!" (Show her your badge.)

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Did you? Wonderful!" She inspects..."
links.text: "Did you? Wonderful!" She inspects the piece of blue plastic, the faded green pearls of her eyes scanning left to right.

links.title: Composure: "Quickly, methodically, like an elec..."
links.text: Quickly, methodically, like an electric printing machine.

links.title: Logic: "She's memorizing your badge number."
links.text: She's memorizing your badge number.

links.title: Joyce Messier: "She hands it back to you: "It is a..."
links.text: She hands it back to you: "It is a relief to see a double-yefreitor here. The situation is precarious to say the least. It needs a quick solution, or we will have a blood bath on our hands."

links.title: You: ""Then I'll find it somehow. Let's t..."
links.text: "Then I'll find it somehow. Let's talk about something else until I do."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Of course." She grabs the mainstay..."
links.text: "Of course." She grabs the mainstay and leans toward you. "But before we do, officer -- let me be perfectly clear..."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""The situation is *extremely* volat..."
links.text: "The situation is *extremely* volatile. The sooner we can speak about this lynching business, the better for all of us."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""I'm afraid I can't say any more un..."
links.text: "I'm afraid I can't say any more until we've taken care of formal protocol."

links.title: You: "Why should I blame it on an artist?"
links.text: Why should I blame it on an artist?

links.title: Drama: "Everyone *knows* you can't trust ar..."
links.text: Everyone *knows* you can't trust artists. They're nearly as bad as *clowns*.

links.title: You: ""Some artist types stole my badge...."
links.text: "Some artist types stole my badge. It was a mistake to trust them."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""You mean someone *stole* your badg..."
links.text: "You mean someone *stole* your badge?" Her brow is slightly arched.

links.title: You: ""They said it was for a *performanc..."
links.text: "They said it was for a *performance*. You know how artists are nowadays."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""I don't, in fact." She shakes her..."
links.text: "I don't, in fact." She shakes her head. "I'm afraid what I need to tell you is wholly unrelated to art. I really need to discuss it, however. With the RCM -- and I need your badge for that."

links.title: Drama: "Unbelievable, sire. Even the *perfo..."
links.text: Unbelievable, sire. Even the *performance* artists didn't work.

links.title: You: ""Some damn *clown* stole it from me..."
links.text: "Some damn *clown* stole it from me. It's a long story."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""You mean someone *stole* your badg..."
links.text: "You mean someone *stole* your badge?" Her brow is slightly arched.

links.title: You: ""I'd rather not get into it, but ye..."
links.text: "I'd rather not get into it, but yes: a bunch of clowns -- and some *arlecchinos* -- stole my badge."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Some *arlecchinos* you say?" She s..."
links.text: "Some *arlecchinos* you say?" She shakes her head. "I'm afraid what I need to tell you is anything but *fun* I really need to discuss it, however. With the RCM -- and I need your badge for that."

links.title: Drama: "Unbelievable, sire. Even the *arlec..."
links.text: Unbelievable, sire. Even the *arlecchinos* didn't work.

links.title: You: ""Remember when I told you I literal..."
links.text: "Remember when I told you I literally cannot remember even the most basic facts about reality?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""How can I forget?" She tilts her h..."
links.text: "How can I forget?" She tilts her head to the side.

links.title: You: ""One of those facts is where my bad..."
links.text: "One of those facts is where my badge is."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""I was hoping your *condition* was..."
links.text: "I was hoping your *condition* was rhetorical, detective. A questioning technique."

links.title: You: ""It's not.""
links.text: "It's not."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""I have sympathy for your *highly*..."
links.text: "I have sympathy for your *highly* unusual conundrum, sir. And I believe you. But as it stands I cannot share any confidential information until I've seen a badge."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I understand the dictates of proto..."
links.text: "I understand the dictates of protocol, ma'am, but... is there no way around it?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""I'm afraid not, lieutenant. These..."
links.text: "I'm afraid not, lieutenant. These are my employer's orders..."

links.title: Suggestion: "Hang on, she's a professional *nego..."
links.text: Hang on, she's a professional *negotiator*. She should be open to some sort of mutually beneficial arrangement.

links.title: Rhetoric: "She's a professional *negotiator*...."
links.text: She's a professional *negotiator*. She should be open to some sort of mutually beneficial arrangement..

links.title: You: ""I wish it were.""
links.text: "I wish it were."

links.title: You: ""Perhaps it is. But it's also true..."
links.text: "Perhaps it is. But it's also true that I don't remember where my badge is."

links.title: You: ""I've recently suffered from an *un..."
links.text: "I've recently suffered from an *unusual* medical episode. My lost badge is related to it."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""I... see..." She looks increasingl..."
links.text: "I... see..." She looks increasingly worried. "So are you saying you *lost* your badge during the course of this *episode*?"

links.title: You: ""It's possible. After a night of he..."
links.text: "It's possible. After a night of heavy drinking I lost all memory of my life and the world."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Oh, *dear*..." She sighs with comp..."
links.text: "Oh, *dear*..." She sighs with compassion, sadness even. "I suppose this does explain some of the more *curious* turns in our conversation."

links.title: Logic: "She must have been suspecting somet..."
links.text: She must have been suspecting something for a while now.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""As I said, ma'am," the lieutenant..."
links.text: "As I said, ma'am," the lieutenant interjects, "his technique may be *very* unconventional. But he *is* an officer of the RCM."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Of course. I sympathize. But I'm a..."
links.text: "Of course. I sympathize. But I'm afraid I simply can't share anything more until I've seen that badge..."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""However," she says, with a touch o..."
links.text: "However," she says, with a touch of regret, "This isn't about my feelings. There's also protocol to consider. I'm afraid I can't say any more until I've seen that badge."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Oh, *dear*..." she sighs with conf..."
links.text: "Oh, *dear*..." she sighs with confusion, sadness even. "Some kind of encephalopathic amnesia? I don't even know how to respond..."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""I *do* believe you -- naive as tha..."
links.text: "I *do* believe you -- naive as that may sound. I simply can't imagine what you'd gain by *faking* such a condition."

links.title: You: ""I could've eaten it for all I know..."
links.text: "I could've eaten it for all I know. I don't remember anything. This world, this city. Nothing."

links.title: You: ""Uhm... yes.""
links.text: "Uhm... yes."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""I can't hear you, darling... speak..."
links.text: "I can't hear you, darling... speak up, please."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Quite a few things, I'm afraid..."..."
links.text: "Quite a few things, I'm afraid..." She falls silent for a moment. Contemplating something.

links.title: Empathy: "Worry lines crease her forehead, bu..."
links.text: Worry lines crease her forehead, but it's more than worry. In her eyes, a hint of... is that *guilt*?

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""The information I'm to share with..."
links.text: "The information I'm to share with you includes sensitive trade secrets. For the sake of my employer, I have to ask for your name and badge number."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Of course, ma'am. We should have i..."
links.text: "Of course, ma'am. We should have introduced ourselves..." The lieutenant hands her a piece of blue plastic. "I'm Lieutenant Kitsuragi, from Precinct 57..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""And this is my colleague from Prec..."
links.text: "And this is my colleague from Precinct 41, Detective Du Bois." He waits for you to show your badge.

links.title: You: ""My badge. Yes. Of course. My badge..."
links.text: "My badge. Yes. Of course. My badge that I have on me."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "He looks at you expectantly. Then i..."
links.text: He looks at you expectantly. Then it dawns on him...

links.title: You: ""I don't seem to have my badge, act..."
links.text: "I don't seem to have my badge, actually..."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""*Oh*. And what happened to it, det..."
links.text: "*Oh*. And what happened to it, detective?" She returns the lieutenant's badge.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""And this is my colleague from Prec..."
links.text: "And this is my colleague from Precinct 41, Detective Du Bois." He points to you. "I'm afraid Harry doesn't have his badge at the moment. I hope mine will suffice."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""*Oh*. And what happened to yours,..."
links.text: "*Oh*. And what happened to yours, detective?" She returns the lieutenant's badge and turns to you.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""And this is my colleague from Prec..."
links.text: "And this is my colleague from Precinct 41." He waits for you to show your badge.

links.title: You: ""My badge. Yes. Of course. My badge..."
links.text: "My badge. Yes. Of course. My badge that I have on me."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "He looks at you expectantly. Then i..."
links.text: He looks at you expectantly. Then it dawns on him...

links.title: You: ""I don't seem to have my badge, act..."
links.text: "I don't seem to have my badge, actually..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""And this is my colleague from Prec..."
links.text: "And this is my colleague from Precinct 41." He points to you. "I'm afraid he doesn't have his badge at the moment. I hope mine will suffice."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""How curious." She returns the lieu..."
links.text: "How curious." She returns the lieutenant's badge and turns to you. "Why is that, detective?"

links.title: You: ""Why is this necessary?""
links.text: "Why is this necessary?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""I just can't go around telling con..."
links.text: "I just can't go around telling confidential information to strangers. I've signed a contract."

links.title: Authority: "But she *knows* you're police."
links.text: But she *knows* you're police.

links.title: You: ""The thing is -- I don't have a bad..."
links.text: "The thing is -- I don't have a badge at this moment."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""What happened to it, detective?""
links.text: "What happened to it, detective?"

links.title: Empathy: "Awkwardness washes over the convers..."
links.text: Awkwardness washes over the conversation. The woman doesn't like this turn of events.

links.title: Drama: "'Twas stolen by some *artist*, sure..."
links.text: 'Twas stolen by some *artist*, surely. Best to pin the blame on them. Everyone *knows* you can't trust artists.

links.title: You: ""My name is Harrier Du Bois, from P..."
links.text: "My name is Harrier Du Bois, from Precinct 41. I don't have a badge *yet*."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""A pleasure to meet you, Harry -- w..."
links.text: "A pleasure to meet you, Harry -- what happened to your badge?"

links.title: You: ""I'm Lieutenant Double-Yefreitor Ha..."
links.text: "I'm Lieutenant Double-Yefreitor Harrier Du Bois, from Precinct 41." (Give her your badge.)

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Pleased to meet you, lieutenant,"..."
links.text: "Pleased to meet you, lieutenant," she inspects the piece of blue plastic, the faded green pearls of her eyes scanning left to right.

links.title: You: ""Do you know something about these..."
links.text: "Do you know something about these tattoos?" (Show her the photo.)

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""That's the man who was killed..."..."
links.text: "That's the man who was killed..." She almost takes the photo -- but then stops. "I'm afraid this is a discussion for once we've cleared the lynching question."

links.title: You: ""So you know something about the ta..."
links.text: "So you know something about the tattoos?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Better not to tie the forestay to..."
links.text: "Better not to tie the forestay to the backstay on this. I hope there is something else I can help you with?"

links.title: Empathy: "She *wants* to answer the question...."
links.text: She *wants* to answer the question. Protocol keeps her from it.

links.title: You: ""Fine, let's return to it later.""
links.text: "Fine, let's return to it later."

links.title: You: ""Why? How is you looking at the pho..."
links.text: "Why? How is you looking at the photo tied to the lynching?"

links.title: You: ""I've got some more questions about..."
links.text: "I've got some more questions about *reality*."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""More lessons in basic reality?" Sh..."
links.text: "More lessons in basic reality?" She's positively surprised. "My favourite part of the day! Go ahead, ask me anything."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Excuse me, I didn't hear you." Her..."
links.text: "Excuse me, I didn't hear you." Her voice is kind, a little hoarse from the wind.

links.title: Volition: "What you meant to say was:"
links.text: What you meant to say was:

links.title: You: ""You seem smart, I need someone to..."
links.text: "You seem smart, I need someone to give me a low-down on this... *reality* we're in."

links.title: Perception (Smell): "A breeze carries with it the faint..."
links.text: A breeze carries with it the faint scent of juniper and oranges.

links.title: Joyce Messier: "While dull orange pearls hang from..."
links.text: While dull orange pearls hang from her ear lobes, red from cold. Her light green eyes scan you, full of knowledge -- and worry. Wealth and all its possibilities.

links.title: Conceptualization: "These are the kind eyes of the rich..."
links.text: These are the kind eyes of the rich-man, that seem to say: everything is possible...

links.title: Logic: "...within reason."
links.text: ...within reason.

links.title: You: "Yeah, so?"
links.text: Yeah, so?

links.title: Inland Empire: "Now look at you, you misery-clad si..."
links.text: Now look at you, you misery-clad simian, barely able to tie your own laces. Your armpits are lakes, a scythe of booze precedes you. Your hair sticks to your forehead and your underwear feels uncomfortable...

links.title: Joyce Messier: "You're poor. Poor as balls. You can..."
links.text: You're poor. Poor as balls. You can't ask this person for money. You're too...

links.title: You: "Ashamed?"
links.text: Ashamed?

links.title: Inland Empire: "Yes. You're too ashamed to ask this..."
links.text: Yes. You're too ashamed to ask this person for *money*, too scared to belittle yourself in her eyes -- those half-precious stones of Eau-de-Nil.

links.title: Authority: "Oh god, the lieutenant is here too!..."
links.text: Oh god, the lieutenant is here too! Do not DISHONOUR the force!

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""As I was saying..." Her voice brea..."
links.text: "As I was saying..." Her voice breaks the silence and suddenly you're back again. Nearby, a seagull pecks at a piece of garbage... "If there's *any* way I may be of assistance, please don't hesitate to ask."

links.title: You: "I'm not ashamed!"
links.text: I'm not ashamed!

links.title: Inland Empire: "Oh, but you are: too ashamed to ask..."
links.text: Oh, but you are: too ashamed to ask this person for *money*, too scared to belittle yourself in her eyes -- those half-precious stones of Eau-de-Nil.

links.title: You: "What is this feeling? I've never fe..."
links.text: What is this feeling? I've never felt it before.

links.title: Inland Empire: "Shame? You haven't really been in t..."
links.text: Shame? You haven't really been in the presence of gentlefolk either, have you? What shame is there to be felt in front of these... dockworkers, cops and hotel clerks. But to *belittle* yourself in these eyes of Eau-de-Nil...

links.title: You: "I'm a god damn working man, I'm not..."
links.text: I'm a god damn working man, I'm not *ashamed* to shake this leech for some dough.

links.title: Inland Empire: "You think your little *communism" p..."
links.text: You think your little *communism" protects you from this feeling? No. The more *demeaning* it is to grovel at her feet...

links.title: You: "As I should be -- for even consider..."
links.text: As I should be -- for even considering it. This is a woman and I'm a *man*.

links.title: Inland Empire: "Yes. You should be able to take car..."
links.text: Yes. You should be able to take care of yourself. Not grovel at her beautiful feet, dishonouring yourself and your organization with this request...

links.title: You: "Yes. I should make my own god damn..."
links.text: Yes. I should make my own god damn money by now.

links.title: Inland Empire: "Maybe you can ask her for some *sto..."
links.text: Maybe you can ask her for some *stock tips* -- that's a *maybe*. Or a *job*. But you're sure as hell too ashamed to ask for cash buddy.

links.title: You: ""You seem rich. Can I have some mon..."
links.text: "You seem rich. Can I have some money?"

links.title: Inland Empire: "...is what you *want* to say. But i..."
links.text: ...is what you *want* to say. But it isn't that easy, is it?

links.title: Physical Instrument: "What is this? An athletic challenge..."
links.text: What is this? An athletic challenge? Scream it from the top of your lungs immediately, show that asshole!

links.title: You: "What, why not?"
links.text: What, why not?

links.title: Inland Empire: "Look at that lady. Take a *gander*...."
links.text: Look at that lady. Take a *gander*. Squint your eyes, bub.

links.title: You: "What nice fabrics."
links.text: What nice fabrics.

links.title: Joyce Messier: "Why yes! Tucked away under that stu..."
links.text: Why yes! Tucked away under that sturdy green raincoat, almost rustic in its simplicity -- a silk shirt and matching scarf around her gentle throat...

links.title: You: "What lustrous hair."
links.text: What lustrous hair.

links.title: Joyce Messier: "A well-kempt, yet tastefully short..."
links.text: A well-kempt, yet tastefully short bob of dark hair. Despite the first hints of grey, she's elected to keep it au naturale -- shaped into a permanent wave, late-Forties style...

links.title: Composure: "Positively statuesque."
links.text: Positively statuesque.

links.title: You: ""YOU SEEM RICH. CAN I HAVE SOME MON..."
links.text: "YOU SEEM RICH. CAN I HAVE SOME MONEY?"

links.title: Inland Empire: "You're thinking it, but your lips a..."
links.text: You're thinking it, but your lips are not moving.

links.title: Joyce Messier: "She looks at you, expectantly. It i..."
links.text: She looks at you, expectantly. It is as if you have said nothing -- because you have not. No begging words have left your mouth...

links.title: You: "Say it: "Can I have some money?""
links.text: Say it: "Can I have some money?"

links.title: Volition: "Voila, you're doing it!"
links.text: Voila, you're doing it!

links.title: Physical Instrument: "Really put your back into it. Yell..."
links.text: Really put your back into it. Yell it from the top of your lungs!

links.title: You: ""You seem rich. Can I have some mon..."
links.text: "You seem rich. Can I have some money?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Why yes, I am rich. How much money..."
links.text: "Why yes, I am rich. How much money do you need? Hopefully not too much, I couldn't bring all of it with me."

links.title: Empathy: "She's surprisingly nonchalant about..."
links.text: She's surprisingly nonchalant about this. If anything, your finally asking it has relieved some of the tension.

links.title: Empathy: "She's surprisingly nonchalant about..."
links.text: She's surprisingly nonchalant about this. Could it be that she somehow knows more about your predicament than she's letting on?

links.title: You: ""Can I have some money, ma'am?""
links.text: "Can I have some money, ma'am?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Of course." She nods, she doesn't..."
links.text: "Of course." She nods, she doesn't even smile. "How much do you need."

links.title: You: ""Help me, I'm poor. I need money to..."
links.text: "Help me, I'm poor. I need money to keep living."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Ah yes, of course, I'm sad to hear..."
links.text: "Ah yes, of course, I'm sad to hear that." She nods, as if its self explanatory. "How much do you need?"

links.title: You: ""MONEY!!!""
links.text: "MONEY!!!"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""I'm sorry, I couldn't hear you," s..."
links.text: "I'm sorry, I couldn't hear you," she chuckles to herself. "The wind is a bit strong, could you repeat that?"

links.title: You: ""I NEED MONEY!!!""
links.text: "I NEED MONEY!!!"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""HOW MUCH MONEY?!""
links.text: "HOW MUCH MONEY?!"

links.title: You: ""I would like 0.1 cents.""
links.text: "I would like 0.1 cents."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""So would I -- but woe! There is no..."
links.text: "So would I -- but woe! There is no such denomination."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Ideas like this one are all part o..."
links.text: "Ideas like this one are all part of his rare medical condition, ma'am. Nothing to be worried about."

links.title: You: ""I need 1 reál.""
links.text: "I need 1 reál."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""No, you don't. One reál won't get..."
links.text: "No, you don't. One reál won't get you two pieces of bath tissue to rub together."

links.title: You: ""I need 30 reál.""
links.text: "I need 30 reál."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""That's a good sum -- not too small..."
links.text: "That's a good sum -- not too small, not fantastically large." She reaches into her raincoat and pulls out a zip bag -- in it you see paper notes arranged like black gills.

links.title: Joyce Messier: "She removes a few notes and hands t..."
links.text: She removes a few notes and hands them to you. The paper is cold and oily to the touch.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant breathes a sigh of r..."
links.text: The lieutenant breathes a sigh of relief. "Good. We won't be needing to go to my Kineema, then."

links.title: Reaction Speed: "There must be about 200 reál in tha..."
links.text: There must be about 200 reál in that zip bag. Maybe a little less. Plus some change at the bottom.

links.title: Suggestion: "Whoa, whoa. Did you see how easy th..."
links.text: Whoa, whoa. Did you see how easy that was? Ask her for more! *Toot-toot* Train to moneytown!

links.title: You: ""Can I have some more?""
links.text: "Can I have some more?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""This may seem like *odd* behaviour..."
links.text: "This may seem like *odd* behaviour for a police officer, ma'am, but it's a perfectly common side effect of his..." He squints at you.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""... unusual medical episode.""
links.text: "... unusual medical episode."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""It's all right, lieutenant." The w..."
links.text: "It's all right, lieutenant." The woman dips her fingers back into the bag. "I really did bring as little cash with me as possible, to avoid attention. So here you are -- the last bit of filthy *lucre* I can share."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Uhm..." The woman dips her fingers..."
links.text: "Uhm..." The woman dips her fingers back into the bag. "I really did bring as little cash as possible, to avoid attention. So here you are, the last of bit of filthy *lucre* I can share."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""So," she returns the zip bag to he..."
links.text: "So," she returns the zip bag to her jacket. "I hope I didn't just *bribe* you, officer. It may not be technically *illegal* under the Emergency Act, but still..."

links.title: You: "Nay, 'twould be dishonourable, and..."
links.text: Nay, 'twould be dishonourable, and mine honour is my life.

links.title: Suggestion: "Can you eat honour? Are you an *hon..."
links.text: Can you eat honour? Are you an *honour-vore?* Give me a break...

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""So," she returns the zip bag to he..."
links.text: "So," she returns the zip bag to her jacket. "I hope I didn't just *bribe* you, officer. It may not be technically *illegal* under the Emergency Act, but still..."

links.title: You: ""You bribed me all right. I'm your..."
links.text: "You bribed me all right. I'm your little *peone* now."

links.title: Interfacing: "You illustrate the expression by ho..."
links.text: You illustrate the expression by holding an imaginary-- and very, very tiny-- *peone* between your thumb and index finger.

links.title: Joyce Messier: "She laughs out loud. It is a beauti..."
links.text: She laughs out loud. It is a beautiful laugh, laced with glee and a certain sharpness. It travels far on the water...

links.title: Joyce Messier: "She clears her throat. "Now, how el..."
links.text: She clears her throat. "Now, how else can I help the RCM today, besides supplementing its salaries?"

links.title: You: ""Certainly not. I am an *honourable..."
links.text: "Certainly not. I am an *honourable* policeman."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""You're right, ma'am, that donation..."
links.text: "You're right, ma'am, that donations are permitted under the Emergency Act, unseemly as it may be, as long as they're properly logged with the precinct..."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Which he most certainly will do."..."
links.text: "Which he most certainly will do." She bows, and then raises a single eyebrow in your direction: "Now, how else can I help the RCM today, besides supplementing its salaries?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""That's heartening to hear. There a..."
links.text: "That's heartening to hear. There are too few honourable men in Revachol." She gives you a slight bow. "Now how else can I help the RCM today, besides supplementing its salaries?"

links.title: You: ""Funny that your worried about this..."
links.text: "Funny that your worried about this and not your ruthless exploitation of the entire *human race*."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Au contraire, officer. I also feel..."
links.text: "Au contraire, officer. I also feel queasy about the pittance the Coalition calls your salary. Now is there something else I can do for you, or did you want to chat about *dialectics* some more?"

links.title: You: ""I'm still getting my head around t..."
links.text: "I'm still getting my head around this whole *money* concept. You were just helping me out."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""It's quite the *phainómenon*, I ag..."
links.text: "It's quite the *phainómenon*, I agree." She bows slightly. "Now how else can I help the RCM today, besides supplementing its salaries?"

links.title: You: ""I want to talk about something els..."
links.text: "I want to talk about something else now."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Of course." She bows slightly. "No..."
links.text: "Of course." She bows slightly. "Now how else can I help the RCM today, besides supplementing its salaries?"

links.title: You: ""I need 60 reál.""
links.text: "I need 60 reál."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""That's a good sum -- not too small..."
links.text: "That's a good sum -- not too small, not fantastically large." She reaches into her raincoat and pulls out a zip bag -- in it you see paper notes arranged like black gills.

links.title: Joyce Messier: "She removes a few notes and hands t..."
links.text: She removes a few notes and hands them to you. The paper is cold and oily to the touch.

links.title: You: ""I need 70 reál.""
links.text: "I need 70 reál."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""That's a reasonable sum -- not too..."
links.text: "That's a reasonable sum -- not too small, not fantastically large." She reaches into her raincoat and pulls out a zip bag -- in it you see paper notes arranged like black gills.

links.title: Joyce Messier: "She removes a few notes and hands t..."
links.text: She removes a few notes and hands them to you. The paper is cold and oily to the touch.

links.title: You: ""I need 100 reál.""
links.text: "I need 100 reál."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""That's a good sum -- not too small..."
links.text: "That's a good sum -- not too small, not fantastically large." She reaches into her raincoat and pulls out a zip bag -- in it you see paper notes arranged like black gills.

links.title: Joyce Messier: "She removes a few notes and hands t..."
links.text: She removes a few notes and hands them to you. The paper is cold and oily to the touch.

links.title: You: ""I need 130 reál.""
links.text: "I need 130 reál."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""That's a good sum -- not too small..."
links.text: "That's a good sum -- not too small, not fantastically large." She reaches into her raincoat and pulls out a zip bag -- in it you see paper notes arranged like black gills.

links.title: Joyce Messier: "She removes a few notes and hands t..."
links.text: She removes a few notes and hands them to you. The paper is cold and oily to the touch.

links.title: You: ""I need 25 reál.""
links.text: "I need 25 reál."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""That's a good sum -- not too small..."
links.text: "That's a good sum -- not too small, not fantastically large." She reaches into her raincoat and pulls out a zip bag -- in it you see paper notes arranged like black gills.

links.title: Joyce Messier: "She removes a few notes and hands t..."
links.text: She removes a few notes and hands them to you. The paper is cold and oily to the touch.

links.title: You: ""I need 10,000 reál.""
links.text: "I need 10,000 reál."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Come now. Nobody carries that much..."
links.text: "Come now. Nobody carries that much cash on their person, particularly in a place like Martinaise... I'd get robbed."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""And even *if* I did I still would..."
links.text: "And even *if* I did I still would not give you ten thousand reál. I would rather buy something nice with it. Like expensive hi-fi or a new *Hydrodynamique E40* sail."

links.title: Rhetoric: "Her tone makes clear that you've vi..."
links.text: Her tone makes clear that you've violated some kind of rich-person taboo. Wouldn't be the first time.

links.title: You: ""Hi-fi? I like high fidelity disco..."
links.text: "Hi-fi? I like high fidelity disco music too."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""I like high fidelity *anything*, s..."
links.text: "I like high fidelity *anything*, sir." She gives you a fast little smile. "Now try again, but lower."

links.title: You: ""Hydrodynamique E40? Sounds fast.""
links.text: "Hydrodynamique E40? Sounds fast."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""It is. Fast and silent." She gives..."
links.text: "It is. Fast and silent." She gives you a crooked little smile. "Try again, but lower."

links.title: You: ""I need a *billion* reál.""
links.text: "I need a *billion* reál."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Excuse me sir, I don't have a bill..."
links.text: "Excuse me sir, I don't have a billion reál."

links.title: You: ""What? I thought you said you had l..."
links.text: "What? I thought you said you had like twenty billion or something."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""That was the annual revenue of the..."
links.text: "That was the annual revenue of the *entire* Wild Pines Group, not my personal fortune..."

links.title: You: ""Oops, I must have misheard.""
links.text: "Oops, I must have misheard."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Try again, dear. A little lower th..."
links.text: "Try again, dear. A little lower this time."

links.title: Volition: "I am sorry. It just doesn't come ou..."
links.text: I am sorry. It just doesn't come out of your mouth. What does is:

links.title: Conceptualization: "Surprisingly eloquent, really. The..."
links.text: Surprisingly eloquent, really. The last one, not the first three -- those are ape-speak.

links.title: You: ""Khnnnnnnnffff...""
links.text: "Khnnnnnnnffff..."

links.title: You: ""Khk...""
You: ""Money...""
links.text: "Money..."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Excuse me, I didn't hear you." her..."
links.text: "Excuse me, I didn't hear you." her voice is kind, a little hoarse from the wind. "Did you say *money*?"

links.title: You: ""No, I didn't. Let's talk about som..."
links.text: "No, I didn't. Let's talk about something else."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Of course." She makes a slight bow..."
links.text: "Of course." She makes a slight bowing motion.

links.title: Empathy: "She understands what you're trying..."
links.text: She understands what you're trying to do -- ask for money. But shame is contagious and she doesn't want to offend you by saying it out loud.

links.title: You: ""I am the scum of the earth.""
links.text: "I am the scum of the earth."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""My...." She doesn't know what to s..."
links.text: "My...." She doesn't know what to say: "Why do you say that?"

links.title: You: ""I'm gunk.""
links.text: "I'm gunk."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""That's garbage! You're a police of..."
links.text: "That's garbage! You're a police officer."

links.title: You: ""No I'm not. I'm gunk.""
links.text: "No I'm not. I'm gunk."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Shall we talk about something else..."
links.text: "Shall we talk about something else maybe?" Her voice is kind, if anything she sounds a little confused.

links.title: You: ""I'm the stuff people have under th..."
links.text: "I'm the stuff people have under their fingernails. Let's talk about something else please."

links.title: You: ""Thank you. That's all for now." [L..."
links.text: "Thank you. That's all for now." [Leave.]

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Of course, detective -- take care.""
links.text: "Of course, detective -- take care."

dialogueTree.title: Joyce Messier: ""Officer, I am *so* sorry for the w..."
dialogueTree.text: "Officer, I am *so* sorry for the whole pier situation."

links.title: Empathy: "Her concern is sincere, her eyes ro..."
links.text: Her concern is sincere, her eyes round and affectionate.

links.title: Drama: "What situation?"
links.text: What situation?

links.title: You: ""No problem, let's resume normal, p..."
links.text: "No problem, let's resume normal, professional relations."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Of course. You have my full cooper..."
links.text: "Of course. You have my full cooperation -- and the cooperation of the Wild Pines Group."

links.title: You: ""Ma'am. You humiliated me.""
links.text: "Ma'am. You humiliated me."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Officer, I don't mean to be rude b..."
links.text: "Officer, I don't mean to be rude but are you sure your recent medical episode wasn't a *stroke*?"

links.title: Volition: "You're being handled. Don't stand f..."
links.text: You're being handled. Don't stand for it.

links.title: You: ""How about we concentrate on the di..."
links.text: "How about we concentrate on the dishonourable thing that happened, huh?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Of course." She slightly bows her..."
links.text: "Of course." She slightly bows her head. "Please accept my apologies. What can I help you with?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""His medical condition makes him a..."
links.text: "His medical condition makes him a little *grumpy*, ma'am. I hope that's not a problem."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Oh no -- not a problem at all.""
links.text: "Oh no -- not a problem at all."

links.title: Composure: "It truly isn't. She controls hersel..."
links.text: It truly isn't. She controls herself very well.

links.title: You: ""Huh, what do you mean?""
links.text: "Huh, what do you mean?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""You stood there for the longest ti..."
links.text: "You stood there for the longest time! And it looked like you were having trouble forming a sentence."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""My mother had a stroke. She exhibi..."
links.text: "My mother had a stroke. She exhibited similar problems -- although not *quite* like yours."

links.title: You: ""Actually, I *might* have suffered..."
links.text: "Actually, I *might* have suffered a stroke. I'm not sure."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Oh, dear, that *is* serious. If th..."
links.text: "Oh, dear, that *is* serious. If this is in any way dangerous for your health, we can always resume our conversation later."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Don't worry. He'll be *fine*. It's..."
links.text: "Don't worry. He'll be *fine*. It's all related to his unusual medical episode." He opens his notebook. "Continue, please. He has questions."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Don't worry. He'll be *fine*. It's..."
links.text: "Don't worry. He'll be *fine*. It's all part of his unusual medical condition." He opens his notebook. "Continue, please. He has questions."

links.title: Pain Threshold: "Don't worry. It'll get better when..."
links.text: Don't worry. It'll get better when you die.

links.title: You: ""No one lives forever, baby.""
links.text: "No one lives forever, baby."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Such a tough guy." She gives you a..."
links.text: "Such a tough guy." She gives you a crooked smile. "You have my full cooperation, tough guy -- and that of the Wild Pines Group."

links.title: You: ""Fuck it... Let's get back to work.""
links.text: "Fuck it... Let's get back to work."

links.title: Joyce Messier: "She quietly nods. "You have my full..."
links.text: She quietly nods. "You have my full cooperation."

links.title: You: ""I called my station's lazareth and..."
links.text: "I called my station's lazareth and they told me to 'drink less.'"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Drinking less sounds like a great..."
links.text: "Drinking less sounds like a great start!" She nods approvingly, but without condescension. "Go on -- you have my full cooperation."

links.title: You: ""I don't *think* it was a stroke.""
links.text: "I don't *think* it was a stroke."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""If you have doubts about your brai..."
links.text: "If you have doubts about your brain's blood supply, well... that's what we call a serious matter."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""A stroke could partially explain t..."
links.text: "A stroke could partially explain the *memory trouble* you've been experiencing."

links.title: You: ""What situation? I don't remember a..."
links.text: "What situation? I don't remember any situation."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Of course." She bows slightly. "Yo..."
links.text: "Of course." She bows slightly. "You have my full cooperation -- and the cooperation of the Wild Pines Group."

dialogueTree.title: Joyce Messier: ""You're back. Good." She takes a si..."
dialogueTree.text: "You're back. Good." She takes a sip from her silvery thermal cup. "What can I help you with -- at this late hour?"

links.title: You: ""It's night. Don't you ever sleep?""
links.text: "It's night. Don't you ever sleep?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Matter of fact, I don't." She take..."
links.text: "Matter of fact, I don't." She takes another sip.

links.title: You: ""Why is that?""
links.text: "Why is that?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""I have a medical condition of my o..."
links.text: "I have a medical condition of my own -- nothing unusual, though. I'm *old* you see."

links.title: Reaction Speed: "Didn't she have *another* medical c..."
links.text: Didn't she have *another* medical condition?

links.title: You: ""Old, huh? I think I have that too.""
links.text: "Old, huh? I think I have that too."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Don't worry. It's curable -- with..."
links.text: "Don't worry. It's curable -- with *questions*. Ask me some, it'll help pass this night."

links.title: You: ""No you're not. You look young.""
links.text: "No you're not. You look young."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Thank you -- I do what I can to re..."
links.text: "Thank you -- I do what I can to remain presentable. Now, ask me some questions. It'll help us pass the night."

links.title: You: ""Were you not overexposed? Does tha..."
links.text: "Were you not overexposed? Does that not cause insomnia?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Very keen of you, officer. I do al..."
links.text: "Very keen of you, officer. I do also have *saudetic syndrome* from overexposure to the pale. It makes me roost in the night. Like an owl."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""I almost never sleep anymore... if..."
links.text: "I almost never sleep anymore... if I do it's for an hour, four tops" She suppresses a yawn. "Go ahead -- ask me some questions. They are the *only* cure."

links.title: Empathy: "Her smile is bitter. There is no cu..."
links.text: Her smile is bitter. There is no cure.

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""It's a medical thing. It's called...."
links.text: "It's a medical thing. It's called... *old*. I'm old you see."

links.title: You: "(Better not to poke further) "That'..."
links.text: (Better not to poke further) "That's good. This way you can answer me some questions."

links.title: You: ""Answer me a question.""
links.text: "Answer me a question."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Of course. That's what I'm here fo..."
links.text: "Of course. That's what I'm here for."

dialogueTree.title: Joyce Messier: ""You're back. Good." She looks at t..."
dialogueTree.text: "You're back. Good." She looks at the ripples on the water's surface. "What can I help you with -- not an umbrella, I hope. I don't need one myself, you see..." She pats her wet raincoat.

links.title: Shivers: "All around you, rain keeps falling..."
links.text: All around you, rain keeps falling down. On the wooden boards she's standing on, and on the water around you...

links.title: You: ""I could use a coat like that. The..."
links.text: "I could use a coat like that. The rain is freezing."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Sadly I need this one myself. It's..."
links.text: "Sadly I need this one myself. It's hydrophobic, repels water, almost *magically*. The company makes them for offshore platform personnel. Very sturdy."

links.title: Joyce Messier: "She gives the material another pat...."
links.text: She gives the material another pat. "What I *can* do for you is answer some *questions*. Nothing like talking to pass a rainy day."

links.title: You: ""Neither do I." (Pat your similarly..."
links.text: "Neither do I." (Pat your similarly wet cloak.)

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Very rugged," she nods in approval..."
links.text: "Very rugged," she nods in approval. "Good choice. Now, I suspect you had questions -- nothing like talking to pass a rainy day, am I right?"

links.title: You: ""No need. Tell me something.""
links.text: "No need. Tell me something."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Of course.""
links.text: "Of course."

dialogueTree.title: Joyce Messier: ""You're back. Good." She takes a si..."
dialogueTree.text: "You're back. Good." She takes a sip from her silvery thermal cup. "What can I help you with?"

dialogueTree.title: Joyce Messier: "A striking woman leans against the..."
dialogueTree.text: A striking woman leans against the cabin top of her sailing boat, smiling as you approach. Her green raincoat glistens with droplets, a silk scarf is tied around her throat.

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Good morning, officers. I'm Joyce...."
links.text: "Good morning, officers. I'm Joyce." She extends her hand in greeting.

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Joyce L. Messier. I represent the..."
links.text: "Joyce L. Messier. I represent the board of Wild Pines -- the owners of the harbour. You gentlemen must be from the RCM..." She steps closer and holds out her hand over the railing.

links.title: You: ""Joyce L? What does the 'L' stand f..."
links.text: "Joyce L? What does the 'L' stand for?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Leyton, my maiden name." Her bony..."
links.text: "Leyton, my maiden name." Her bony hand dangles from the sleeve of her oversized raincoat.

links.title: You: ""RCM -- what is that? I'm a little..."
links.text: "RCM -- what is that? I'm a little *foggy* here."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Uhm..." She seems confused. "I mea..."
links.text: "Uhm..." She seems confused. "I meant *you* -- the Revachol Citizens Militia. The police."

links.title: You: ""What gave me away?""
links.text: "What gave me away?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Nothing, honestly. I've said it to..."
links.text: "Nothing, honestly. I've said it to every drunk in town and you're the first one who's responded."

links.title: Authority: "What is implied here?! That you're..."
links.text: What is implied here?! That you're a *drunk*?!

links.title: Conceptualization: "She hasn't actually said it to ever..."
links.text: She hasn't actually said it to every drunk in town. It was spoken in jest.

links.title: Conceptualization: "Relax. She meant it in jest."
links.text: Relax. She meant it in jest.

links.title: You: ""I'm not a drunk. I'm a police offi..."
links.text: "I'm not a drunk. I'm a police officer."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Of course you're not. It was only..."
links.text: "Of course you're not. It was only a joke."

links.title: You: "Shake her hand."
links.text: Shake her hand.

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""I'm glad to see you here." Her gri..."
links.text: "I'm glad to see you here." Her grip is tight and cold.

links.title: Interfacing: "Like steel. There is strength there..."
links.text: Like steel. There is strength there. If she wanted, she could sink her nails deep into your skin.

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""I was dispatched to handle a strik..."
links.text: "I was dispatched to handle a strike, not a lynching. Anything I can do to assist the RCM in this matter, I will, gladly."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""That is good to hear, madam." He o..."
links.text: "That is good to hear, madam." He opens his notebook. "My colleague will take the lead on this interview. I should let you know that he's recovering from an *unusual* medical episode -- *very* unusual -- but I can assure you of his ultimate competency."

links.title: Rhetoric: "There's a trace of irony in his voi..."
links.text: There's a trace of irony in his voice. Mischief even. This is a tactic.

links.title: Reaction Speed: "It happens quicker than a shooting..."
links.text: It happens quicker than a shooting star -- but did the lieutenant just *wink* at you?

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""How interesting." She turns to you..."
links.text: "How interesting." She turns to you, unfazed. "I wish you a swift recovery. In the meanwhile, you have my *full* cooperation. And the full cooperation of the Wild Pines Group."

links.title: Suggestion: "It's hard to get a read on her prec..."
links.text: It's hard to get a read on her precise disposition, but she *appears* helpful.

links.title: Empathy: "There's a trace of irony in his voi..."
links.text: There's a trace of irony in his voice. Mischief even. The lieutenant is hatching some scheme.

links.title: Rhetoric: "He's trying to signal something. He..."
links.text: He's trying to signal something. He *wants* you to play up your condition.

links.title: You: "Don't shake her hand."
links.text: Don't shake her hand.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I'm afraid my partner doesn't shak..."
links.text: "I'm afraid my partner doesn't shake hands. Please don't take offence."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""None taken, officer." They exchang..."
links.text: "None taken, officer." They exchange a brief handshake. "Either way, I'm glad you're both here now."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""I'm glad to see you here." The wom..."
links.text: "I'm glad to see you here." The woman and the lieutenant exchange a brief handshake.

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""I'm glad to see you here." She wit..."
links.text: "I'm glad to see you here." She withdraws her small hand and picks up her cup.

links.title: Empathy: "She is unfazed by your rudeness, pr..."
links.text: She is unfazed by your rudeness, probably chocking it up to local custom.

links.title: You: ""Sail away.""
links.text: "Sail away."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Joyce L. Messier. I represent the..."
links.text: "Joyce L. Messier. I represent the board of Wild Pines -- the owners of the harbour. You must be from the RCM..." She steps closer and holds out her hand over the railing.

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Good morning, officer. I'm Joyce."..."
links.text: "Good morning, officer. I'm Joyce." She extends her hand in greeting.

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Good afternoon, officers, I'm Joyc..."
links.text: "Good afternoon, officers, I'm Joyce." She extends her hand in greeting.

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Good afternoon, officer, I'm Joyce..."
links.text: "Good afternoon, officer, I'm Joyce." She extends her hand in greeting.

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Good evening, officers, I'm Joyce...."
links.text: "Good evening, officers, I'm Joyce." She extends her hand in greeting.

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Good evening, officer, I'm Joyce."..."
links.text: "Good evening, officer, I'm Joyce." She extends her hand in greeting.
